grib2io.xarray_backend

grib2io Backend Engine for Xarray

grib2io provides a Xarray backend entrypoint for decoding many GRIB2 messages from a single file or many files and represented as Xarray DataArray objects and collected along common coordinates as Datasets and DataTrees.

The grib2io.xarray_backend engine API is experimental. Its interface and behavior may change in future releases, which could affect backward compatibility.

Users are encouraged to treat this backend as subject to change and to pin their grib2io version if depending on its current implementation details.

   1"""
   2grib2io Backend Engine for Xarray
   3=================================
   4grib2io provides a Xarray backend entrypoint for decoding many GRIB2 messages
   5from a single file or many files and represented as Xarray DataArray objects and
   6collected along common coordinates as Datasets and DataTrees.
   7
   8.. warning::
   9
  10   The ``grib2io.xarray_backend`` engine API is **experimental**.
  11   Its interface and behavior may change in future releases,
  12   which could affect backward compatibility.
  13
  14   Users are encouraged to treat this backend as subject to change
  15   and to pin their ``grib2io`` version if depending on its current
  16   implementation details.
  17"""
  18from grib2io._grib2io import _data

  45# Check if xarray version supports DataTree
  46HAS_DATATREE = False
  47try:
  48    # Try importing DataTree to check if it's available
  49    xarray_version = importlib.metadata.version('xarray')
  50    xarray_parts = [int(x) if x.isdigit() else x for x in xarray_version.split('.')]
  51    min_version_parts = [2024, 10, 0]
  52    HAS_DATATREE = xarray_parts >= min_version_parts
  53except (ImportError, ValueError):
  54    HAS_DATATREE = False

 145def parse_data_model(ds, data_model):
 146
 147    def _decode_ptype(values):
 148        """
 149        Decode precipitation type values into human-readable strings.
 150
 151        Args:
 152            values: Array of numeric precipitation type codes
 153
 154        Returns:
 155            numpy.ndarray: Array of decoded precipitation type strings
 156
 157        Uses GRIB2 Table 4.201 to map numeric codes to precipitation type descriptions.
 158        """
 159        results = []
 160        for val in values:
 161            # Convert each numeric code to string and look up in Table 4.201
 162            results.append(str(tables.get_value_from_table(str(int(val)), '4.201')))
 163
 164        # Return array of strings using numpy's string data type
 165        return np.array(results, dtype=np.dtypes.StringDType)
 166
 167    # convert coordinates and attributes to CF if requested
 168    if data_model == 'nws-viz':
 169
 170        # define regex to convert to snake case
 171        pattern = re.compile(r'(?<!^)(?=[A-Z])')
 172
 173        # check for coordinates and rename
 174        for coord in ds.coords:
 175            if coord == 'refDate':
 176                ds = ds.rename({'refDate': 'forecast_reference_time'})
 177
 178            elif coord == 'leadTime':
 179                ds = ds.rename({'leadTime': 'lead_time'})
 180
 181            elif coord == 'validDate':
 182                ds = ds.rename({'validDate': 'time'})
 183
 184            elif coord == 'percentileValue':
 185                ds = ds.rename({'percentileValue': 'percentile'})
 186
 187            elif coord == 'thresholdLowerLimit':
 188                ds = ds.rename({'thresholdLowerLimit': 'threshold_lower_limit'})
 189                ds['threshold_lower_limit'].attrs['long_name'] = 'Threshold Lower Limit'
 190                ds['threshold_lower_limit'].attrs['units'] = ds[list(ds.data_vars.keys())[0]].attrs['units']
 191
 192                if 'PTYPE' in ds.data_vars:
 193                    ds['threshold_lower_limit'] = xr.apply_ufunc(_decode_ptype, ds['threshold_lower_limit'])
 194
 195                # check if thresholdLowerLimit should be a dimension coordinate
 196                if 'threshold' in ds.dims:
 197                    var_key = list(ds.data_vars.keys())[0]
 198                    prob_types = [
 199                        'Probability of event below lower limit',
 200                        'Probability of event above lower limit',
 201                        'Probability of event equal to lower limit',
 202                        'Probability of event between upper and lower limits (the range includes lower limit but not the upper limit)'
 203                    ]
 204                    if ds[var_key].attrs['typeOfProbability'] in prob_types:
 205                        ds = ds.swap_dims({'threshold': 'threshold_lower_limit'})
 206
 207            elif coord == 'thresholdUpperLimit':
 208                ds = ds.rename({'thresholdUpperLimit': 'threshold_upper_limit'})
 209                ds['threshold_upper_limit'].attrs['long_name'] = 'Threshold Upper Limit'
 210                ds['threshold_upper_limit'].attrs['units'] = ds[list(ds.data_vars.keys())[0]].attrs['units']
 211
 212                if 'PTYPE' in ds.data_vars:
 213                    ds['threshold_upper_limit'] = xr.apply_ufunc(_decode_ptype, ds['threshold_upper_limit'])
 214
 215                if 'threshold' in ds.dims:
 216                    var_key = list(ds.data_vars.keys())[0]
 217                    prob_types = [
 218                        'Probability of event below upper limit',
 219                        'Probability of event above upper limit'
 220                    ]
 221                    if ds[var_key].attrs['typeOfProbability'] in prob_types:
 222                        ds = ds.swap_dims({'threshold': 'threshold_upper_limit'})
 223
 224            # If the dataset has valueOfFirstFixedSurface as a coordinate
 225            elif coord == 'valueOfFirstFixedSurface':
 226                # Get the valueOfFirstFixedSurface coordinate
 227                da = ds.valueOfFirstFixedSurface
 228
 229                # Get the definition and units from typeOfFirstFixedSurface
 230                var_key = list(ds.data_vars.keys())[0]
 231                definition, units = ds[var_key].attrs['typeOfFirstFixedSurface']
 232
 233                if definition in VERTICAL_COORDINATE_SURFACES:
 234                    # Convert definition to lowercase and replace spaces with underscores
 235                    key = definition.lower().replace(' ', '_')
 236
 237                    # remove special characters
 238                    key = re.sub(r'[^a-z0-9_]', '', key)
 239
 240                    # Add units and grib_name attributes
 241                    da.attrs['units'] = units
 242                    da.attrs['grib_name'] = ['valueOfFirstFixedSurface', 'typeOfFirstFixedSurface']
 243
 244                    # Assign the coordinate with the new key name
 245                    ds = ds.assign_coords({key: da})
 246
 247                    # If valueOfFirstFixedSurface is a dimension, swap it with the new key
 248                    if 'level' in ds.dims:
 249                        ds = ds.swap_dims({"level": key})
 250
 251                # Remove the original coordinates
 252                del ds['valueOfFirstFixedSurface']
 253
 254            # If the dataset has valueOfSecondFixedSurface as a coordinate
 255            elif coord == 'valueOfSecondFixedSurface':
 256                # Get the valueOfSecondFixedSurface coordinate
 257                da = ds.valueOfSecondFixedSurface
 258
 259                # Get the definition and units from typeOfSecondFixedSurface
 260                var_key = list(ds.data_vars.keys())[0]
 261                definition, units = ds[var_key].attrs['typeOfSecondFixedSurface']
 262
 263                if definition in VERTICAL_COORDINATE_SURFACES:
 264                    # Convert definition to lowercase and replace spaces with underscores
 265                    key = definition.lower().replace(' ', '_')
 266
 267                    # remove special characters
 268                    key = re.sub(r'[^a-z0-9_]', '', key)
 269
 270                    # check if key is already in coords
 271                    if key in ds.coords:
 272                        key = key + '_2'
 273
 274                    # Add units and grib_name attributes
 275                    da.attrs['units'] = units
 276                    da.attrs['grib_name'] = ['valueOfSecondFixedSurface', 'typeOfSecondFixedSurface']
 277
 278                    # Assign the coordinate with the new key name
 279                    ds = ds.assign_coords({key: da})
 280
 281                # Remove the original coordinates
 282                del ds['valueOfSecondFixedSurface']
 283            else:
 284                # change coord name to snake case
 285                new_coord_name = pattern.sub('_', coord).lower()
 286                ds = ds.rename({coord: new_coord_name})
 287
 288        # convert all attributes and variable names to snake case
 289        for var in ds.data_vars:
 290            da = ds[var]
 291            record = tables.get_table('shortname_to_cf').get(da.name)
 292            da.attrs['standard_name'] = 'unknown' if record is None else record['cf_standard_name']
 293            da.attrs['cell_methods'] = 'unknown' if record is None else record['cf_cell_methods']
 294
 295            ds[var] = da
 296
 297            # rename variable
 298            new_var_name = var.lower()
 299            ds = ds.rename({var: new_var_name})
 300
 301            # remove attr for typeOfFirstFixedSurface (applied as coordinate above)
 302            if 'typeOfFirstFixedSurface' in ds[new_var_name].attrs:
 303                definition, units = ds[new_var_name].attrs['typeOfFirstFixedSurface']
 304                ds[new_var_name].attrs['typeOfFirstFixedSurface'] = f'{definition} ({units})'
 305
 306            if 'typeOfSecondFixedSurface' in ds[new_var_name].attrs:
 307                definition, units = ds[new_var_name].attrs['typeOfSecondFixedSurface']
 308                ds[new_var_name].attrs['typeOfSecondFixedSurface'] = f'{definition} ({units})'
 309
 310            ds[new_var_name].attrs.pop('percentileValue', None)
 311
 312            if 'threshold_lower_limit' in ds.coords:
 313                ds[new_var_name].attrs.pop('thresholdLowerLimit', None)
 314
 315            if 'threshold_upper_limit' in ds.coords:
 316                ds[new_var_name].attrs.pop('thresholdUpperLimit', None)
 317
 318            for attr in list(ds[new_var_name].attrs.keys()):
 319                # skip grib section attrs
 320                if 'GRIB2IO_section' in attr:
 321                    # replace GRIB2IO with grib in attr
 322                    new_attr_name = attr.replace('GRIB2IO', 'grib')
 323                else:
 324                    # change attr name to snake case
 325                    new_attr_name = pattern.sub('_', attr).lower()
 326
 327                # update new attr name for specific CF names
 328                if new_attr_name == 'full_name':
 329                    new_attr_name = 'long_name'
 330
 331                # change % to percent
 332                if attr == 'units' and ds[new_var_name].attrs[attr] == '%':
 333                    ds[new_var_name].attrs[attr] = 'percent'
 334
 335                if new_var_name == 'ptype' and 'threshold' in new_attr_name:
 336                    value = ds[new_var_name].attrs.pop(attr)
 337                    ds[new_var_name].attrs[attr] = _decode_ptype(value)
 338                else:
 339                    # change attr name in attrs
 340                    ds[new_var_name].attrs[new_attr_name] = ds[new_var_name].attrs.pop(attr)
 341
 342
 343        # change dataset attrs to snake case
 344        for attr in list(ds.attrs.keys()):
 345            # change attr name to snake case
 346            new_attr_name = pattern.sub('_', attr).lower()
 347
 348            # change attr name in attrs
 349            ds.attrs[new_attr_name] = ds.attrs.pop(attr)
 350
 351        # change % to percent
 352        for coord in ds.coords:
 353            if 'units' in ds[coord].attrs and ds[coord].attrs['units'] == '%':
 354                ds[coord].attrs['units'] = 'percent'
 355
 356    return ds

 359class GribBackendEntrypoint(BackendEntrypoint):
 360    """
 361    xarray backend engine entrypoint for opening and decoding grib2 files.
 362
 363    .. warning::
 364
 365       This backend is experimental and the API/behavior may change without
 366       backward compatibility.
 367    """
 368
 369    def open_dataset(
 370        self,
 371        filename,
 372        *,
 373        drop_variables=None,
 374        filters: typing.Mapping[str, typing.Any] = dict(),
 375        data_model=None
 376    ):
 377        """
 378        Read and parse metadata from grib file.
 379
 380        Parameters
 381        ----------
 382        filename
 383            GRIB2 file to be opened.
 384        filters
 385            Filter GRIB2 messages to single hypercube. Dict keys can be any
 386            GRIB2 metadata attribute name.
 387        data_model
 388            Parse GRIB metadata following a defined data model comvention.
 389
 390        Returns
 391        -------
 392        open_dataset
 393            Xarray dataset of grib2 messages.
 394        """
 395        with grib2io.open(filename, _xarray_backend=True) as f:
 396            file_index = pd.DataFrame(f._index)
 397            file_index = file_index.assign(msg=msgs_from_index(f._index))
 398
 399        # parse grib2io _index to dataframe and acquire non-geo possible dims
 400        # (scalar coord when not dim due to squeeze) parse_grib_index applies
 401        # filters to index and expands metadata based on product definition
 402        # template number
 403        file_index, dim_coords, attrs, coord_attrs = parse_grib_index(file_index, filters)
 404
 405        # Divide up records by variable
 406        frames, cube, extra_geo = make_variables(file_index, filename, dim_coords)  # have this return var_attrs
 407
 408        # return empty dataset if no data
 409        if frames is None:
 410            return xr.Dataset()
 411
 412        # create dataframe and add datarrays without any coords
 413        ds = xr.Dataset()
 414        for var_df in frames:
 415            da = build_da_without_coords(var_df, cube, filename, attrs)
 416            ds[da.name] = da
 417
 418        # add coords and dataset meta
 419        ds = assign_xr_meta(ds, frames, cube, dim_coords, extra_geo, coord_attrs)
 420
 421        if data_model is not None:
 422            ds = parse_data_model(ds, data_model)
 423
 424        # assign attributes
 425        ds.attrs['engine'] = 'grib2io'
 426
 427        return ds
 428
 429    def open_datatree(
 430        self,
 431        filename,
 432        *,
 433        drop_variables=None,
 434        filters: typing.Mapping[str, typing.Any] = None,
 435        stack_vertical: bool = False,
 436    ):
 437        """
 438        Open a GRIB2 file as an xarray DataTree.
 439
 440        Parameters
 441        ----------
 442        filename : str
 443            Path to the GRIB2 file.
 444        drop_variables : list, optional
 445            List of variables to exclude.
 446        filters : dict, optional
 447            Filter criteria for GRIB2 messages.
 448        stack_vertical : bool, optional
 449            If True, organize the tree with vertical layers stacked in a single dataset.
 450
 451        Returns
 452        -------
 453        xarray.DataTree
 454            A hierarchical DataTree representation of the GRIB2 data.
 455        """
 456        if not HAS_DATATREE:
 457            raise ImportError("xarray version does not support DataTree functionality.")
 458
 459        if filters is None:
 460            filters = {}
 461
 462        # Open the file without any filters first to get all messages
 463        with grib2io.open(filename, _xarray_backend=True) as f:
 464            file_index = pd.DataFrame(f._index)
 465            file_index = file_index.assign(msg=msgs_from_index(f._index))
 466
 467        # Build tree structure from GRIB messages with specified options
 468        tree = build_datatree_from_grib(filename, file_index, filters, stack_vertical=stack_vertical)
 469
 470        # Put warning here so it is the last message from likely other Xarray warnings.
 471        warnings.warn(
 472            "grib2io’s xarray backend DataTree support is experimental. "
 473            "The DataTree structure or attributes may change in future releases.",
 474        UserWarning,
 475        stacklevel=2,
 476        )
 477
 478        return tree

 481class GribBackendArray(BackendArray):
 482
 483    def __init__(self, array, lock):
 484        self.array = array
 485        self.shape = array.shape
 486        self.dtype = np.dtype(array.dtype)
 487        self.lock = lock
 488
 489    def __getitem__(self, key: xr.core.indexing.ExplicitIndexer) -> np.typing.ArrayLike:
 490        return xr.core.indexing.explicit_indexing_adapter(
 491            key,
 492            self.shape,
 493            indexing.IndexingSupport.BASIC,
 494            self._raw_getitem,
 495        )
 496
 497    def _raw_getitem(self, key: tuple):
 498        """Implement thread safe access to data on disk."""
 499        with self.lock:
 500            return self.array[key]
 501
 502
 503def exclusive_slice_to_inclusive(item: slice):
 504    """
 505    Convert a slice with exclusive stop to an inclusive slice.
 506
 507    If the slice has a step, the stop is reduced by the step, so that both
 508    interpretations would yield the same result.
 509
 510    The means that [start, stop) is converted to [start, stop - step].
 511
 512    Parameters
 513    ----------
 514    item
 515        The slice to convert.
 516
 517    Returns
 518    -------
 519    slice
 520        The converted slice.
 521    """
 522    # return the None slice
 523    if item.start is None and item.stop is None and item.step is None:
 524        return item
 525    if not isinstance(item, slice):
 526        raise ValueError(f'item must be a slice; it was of type {type(item)}')
 527    # if step is None, it's one
 528    step = 1 if item.step is None else item.step
 529    if item.stop < item.start or step < 1:
 530        raise ValueError(f'slice {item} not accounted for')
 531    # handle case where slice has one item
 532    if abs(item.stop - item.start) == step:
 533        return [item.start]
 534    # other cases require reducing the stop by the step
 535    s = slice(item.start, item.stop - step, step)
 536    return s

 539class Validator:
 540    def __set_name__(self, owner, name):
 541        self.private_name = f'_{name}'
 542        self.name = name
 543
 544    def __get__(self, obj, objtype=None):
 545        try:
 546            value = getattr(obj, self.private_name)
 547        except AttributeError:
 548            value = None
 549        return value
 550
 551
 552class PdIndex(Validator):
 553
 554    def __set__(self, obj, value):
 555        try:
 556            value = pd.Index(value)
 557        except TypeError:
 558            value = pd.Index([value])
 559        setattr(obj, self.private_name, value)

 562def _asarray_tuplesafe(values):
 563    """
 564    Convert values to a numpy array of at most 1-dimension and preserve tuples.
 565
 566    Adapted from pandas.core.common._asarray_tuplesafe
 567    """
 568    if isinstance(values, tuple):
 569        result = np.empty(1, dtype=object)
 570        result[0] = values
 571    else:
 572        result = np.asarray(values)
 573        if result.ndim == 2:
 574            result = np.empty(len(values), dtype=object)
 575            result[:] = values
 576
 577    return result

 580def array_safe_eq(a, b) -> bool:
 581    """Check if a and b are equal, even if they are numpy arrays."""
 582    if a is b:
 583        return True
 584    if hasattr(a, 'equals'):
 585        return a.equals(b)
 586    if hasattr(a, 'all') and hasattr(b, 'all'):
 587        return a.shape == b.shape and (a == b).all()
 588    if hasattr(a, 'all') or hasattr(b, 'all'):
 589        return False
 590    try:
 591        return a == b
 592    except TypeError:
 593        return NotImplementedError
 594
 595
 596def dc_eq(dc1, dc2) -> bool:
 597    """Check if two dataclasses which hold numpy arrays are equal."""
 598    if dc1 is dc2:
 599        return True
 600    if dc1.__class__ is not dc2.__class__:
 601        return NotImplementedError
 602    t1 = astuple(dc1)
 603    t2 = astuple(dc2)
 604    return all(array_safe_eq(a1, a2) for a1, a2 in zip(t1, t2))
 605
 606
 607def coords_from_cube(cube) -> typing.Dict[str, xr.Variable]:
 608    keys = list(cube.keys())
 609    keys.remove('x')
 610    keys.remove('y')
 611    coords = dict()
 612    for k in keys:
 613        if k is not None:
 614            if len(cube[k]) > 1:
 615                coords[k] = xr.Variable(dims=k, data=cube[k], attrs=dict(grib_name=k))
 616            elif len(cube[k]) == 1:
 617                coords[k] = xr.Variable(dims=tuple(), data=cube[k][0], attrs=dict(grib_name=k))
 618    return coords

 621@dataclass
 622class OnDiskArray:
 623    file_name: str
 624    index: pd.DataFrame = field(repr=False)
 625    cube: dict = field(repr=False)
 626    shape: typing.Tuple[int, ...] = field(init=False)
 627    ndim: int = field(init=False)
 628    geo_ndim: int = field(init=False)
 629    dtype = 'float32'
 630
 631    def __post_init__(self):
 632        # multiple grids not allowed so can just use first
 633        geo_shape = (self.index.iloc[0].ny, self.index.iloc[0].nx)
 634
 635        self.geo_shape = geo_shape
 636        self.geo_ndim = len(geo_shape)
 637
 638        if len(self.index) == 1:
 639            self.shape = geo_shape
 640        else:
 641            if self.index.index.nlevels == 1:
 642                self.shape = tuple([len(self.index.index)]) + geo_shape
 643            else:
 644                self.shape = tuple([len(i) for i in self.index.index.levels]) + geo_shape
 645        self.ndim = len(self.shape)
 646
 647        cols = ['msg', 'sectionOffset']
 648        self.index = self.index[cols]
 649
 650    def __getitem__(self, item) -> np.array:
 651        # dimensions not in index are internal to tdlpack records; 2 dims for
 652        # grids; 1 dim for stations
 653
 654        index_slicer = item[:-self.geo_ndim]
 655        # maintain all multindex levels
 656        index_slicer = tuple([[i] if isinstance(i, int) else i for i in index_slicer])
 657
 658        # pandas loc slicing is inclusive, therefore convert slices into
 659        # explicit lists
 660        index_slicer_inclusive = tuple([exclusive_slice_to_inclusive(
 661            i) if isinstance(i, slice) else i for i in index_slicer])
 662
 663        # get records selected by item in new index dataframe
 664        if len(index_slicer_inclusive) == 1:
 665            index = self.index.loc[index_slicer_inclusive]
 666        elif len(index_slicer_inclusive) > 1:
 667            index = self.index.loc[index_slicer_inclusive, :]
 668        else:
 669            index = self.index
 670        index = index.set_index(index.index)
 671
 672        # set miloc to new relative locations in sub array
 673        index['miloc'] = list(
 674            zip(*[index.index.unique(level=dim).get_indexer(index.index.get_level_values(dim)) for dim in index.index.names]))
 675
 676        if len(index_slicer_inclusive) == 1:
 677            array_field_shape = tuple([len(index.index)]) + self.geo_shape
 678        elif len(index_slicer_inclusive) > 1:
 679            array_field_shape = index.index.levshape + self.geo_shape
 680        else:
 681            array_field_shape = self.geo_shape
 682
 683        array_field = np.full(array_field_shape, fill_value=np.nan, dtype="float32")
 684
 685        with open(self.file_name, mode='rb') as filehandle:
 686            for key, row in index.iterrows():
 687
 688                bitmap_offset = None if pd.isna(row['sectionOffset'][6]) else int(row['sectionOffset'][6])
 689                values = _data(filehandle, row.msg, bitmap_offset, row['sectionOffset'][7])
 690
 691                if len(index_slicer_inclusive) >= 1:
 692                    array_field[row.miloc] = values
 693                else:
 694                    array_field = values
 695
 696        # handle geo dim slicing
 697        array_field = array_field[(Ellipsis,) + item[-self.geo_ndim:]]
 698
 699        # squeeze array dimensions expressed as integer
 700        for i, it in reversed(list(enumerate(item[: -self.geo_ndim]))):
 701            if isinstance(it, int):
 702                array_field = array_field[(slice(None, None, None),) * i + (0,)]
 703
 704        return array_field
 705
 706
 707def dims_to_shape(d) -> tuple:
 708    if 'nx' in d:
 709        t = (d['ny'], d['nx'])
 710    else:
 711        t = (d['nsta'],)
 712    return t
 713
 714
 715def filter_index(index, k, v):
 716    if isinstance(v, slice):
 717        index = index.set_index(k)
 718        index = index.loc[v]
 719        index = index.reset_index()
 720    else:
 721        label = (
 722            v
 723            if getattr(v, "ndim", 1) > 1  # vectorized-indexing
 724            else _asarray_tuplesafe(v)
 725        )
 726        if label.ndim == 0:
 727            # see https://github.com/pydata/xarray/pull/4292 for details
 728            label_value = label[()] if label.dtype.kind in "mM" else label.item()
 729            try:
 730                indexer = pd.Index(index[k]).get_loc(label_value)
 731                if isinstance(indexer, int):
 732                    index = index.iloc[[indexer]]
 733                else:
 734                    index = index.iloc[indexer]
 735            except KeyError:
 736                index = index.iloc[[]]
 737        else:
 738            indexer = pd.Index(index[k]).get_indexer_for(np.ravel(v))
 739            index = index.iloc[indexer[indexer >= 0]]
 740
 741    return index
 742
 743
 744def parse_grib_index(
 745    index: pd.DataFrame,
 746    filters: typing.Mapping[str, typing.Any] = dict(),
 747):
 748    """
 749    Apply filters.
 750
 751    Evaluate remaining dimensions based on pdtn and parse each out.
 752
 753    Parameters
 754    ----------
 755    index
 756        Pandas DataFrame containing the GRIB2 message index.
 757    filters
 758        Filter GRIB2 messages to single hypercube. Dict keys can be any
 759        GRIB2 metadata attribute name.
 760
 761    Returns
 762    -------
 763    index
 764        Modified Pandas DataFrame with added GRIB2 metadata columns.
 765    dim_coords
 766        List of GRIB2 attributes that will be used for coordinates and/or dimensions.
 767    attrs
 768        Dict of metadata attributes (non-coordinates, non-geo)
 769    """
 770
 771    # make a copy of filters, remove filters as they are applied
 772    filters = copy(filters)
 773
 774    for k, v in filters.items():
 775        if k not in index.columns:
 776            kwarg = {k: index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, k))}
 777            index = index.assign(**kwarg)
 778        # adopt parts of xarray's sel logic  so that filters behave similarly
 779        # allowed to filter to nothing to make empty dataset
 780        index = filter_index(index, k, v)
 781
 782    if len(index) == 0:
 783        return index, list()
 784
 785    dim_coords = dict()  # key=name of dim, value=list of coord names
 786    attrs = dict()
 787    coord_attrs = dict()
 788
 789    # expand index
 790    index = index.assign(shortName=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.shortName))
 791    index = index.assign(nx=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.nx))
 792    index = index.assign(ny=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.ny))
 793    index = index.astype({'ny': 'int', 'nx': 'int'})
 794
 795    # apply common filters(to all definition templates) to reduce dataset to
 796    # single cube
 797    # ensure only one of each of the below exists after filters applied
 798    required_uniques = [
 799        "productDefinitionTemplateNumber",
 800        "typeOfGeneratingProcess",
 801        "typeOfFirstFixedSurface",
 802        "typeOfSecondFixedSurface",
 803    ]
 804
 805    def meta_check(index, attrs, meta):
 806        """
 807        add meta to the datframe index
 808        check that there is a single type
 809        add the type to attrs
 810
 811        returns index, attrs
 812        """
 813        index = index.assign(**{meta: index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, meta))})
 814
 815        unique = index[meta].unique()
 816        if len(index[meta].unique()) > 1:
 817            raise ValueError(f'filter to a single {meta}; found: {[str(i) for i in unique]}')
 818        value = unique.item()
 819        if type(value) == grib2io.templates.Grib2Metadata:
 820            value = value.definition
 821
 822        # None is returned if no value found,
 823        # check and change to string None
 824        if value is None:
 825            value = 'None'
 826
 827        attrs[meta] = value
 828        return index, attrs
 829
 830    for meta in required_uniques:
 831        index, attrs = meta_check(index, attrs, meta)
 832
 833    pdtn = index.productDefinitionTemplateNumber.iloc[0].value
 834
 835    # determine which non geo dimensions can be created from data by this point
 836    # the index is filtered down to a single type for all required_uniques
 837
 838    # Dim Name     # matching dim_name for using this data as index coordinate
 839    dim_coords["refDate"] = ["refDate"]
 840    coord_attrs["refDate"] = dict(standard_name="forecast_reference_time")
 841#   dim_coords["refDate"] = ["refDate", "hour"] # non dim name matching items in list are used as non-index coordinates
 842
 843    dim_coords["leadTime"] = ["leadTime"]
 844    coord_attrs["leadTime"] = dict(standard_name="forecast_period")
 845
 846    if 'valueOfFirstFixedSurface' not in index.columns:
 847        index = index.assign(valueOfFirstFixedSurface=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.valueOfFirstFixedSurface))
 848    if 'valueOfsecondFixedSurface' not in index.columns:
 849        index = index.assign(valueOfSecondFixedSurface=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.valueOfSecondFixedSurface))
 850
 851    # dim name api change, user could run ds = ds.swap_dims(fixedSurface="valueOfFirstFixedSurface")
 852    index = index.assign(level=list(zip(index['valueOfFirstFixedSurface'], index['valueOfSecondFixedSurface'])))
 853#   index = index.assign(level=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.level))
 854    # lack of "level" indeicates don't create extra index coordinate "level"
 855    dim_coords["level"] = ["valueOfFirstFixedSurface", "valueOfSecondFixedSurface"]
 856
 857    # logic for parsing possible dims from specific product definition section
 858
 859    if pdtn in {5, 9}:
 860
 861        # Probability forecasts at a horizontal level or in a horizontal layer
 862        # in a continuous or non-continuous time interval.  (see Template
 863        # 4.9)
 864        #       AVAILABLE_THRESHOLD = {
 865        #           0: {'has_lower': True, 'has_upper': False},
 866        #           1: {'has_lower': False, 'has_upper': True},
 867        #           2: {'has_lower': True, 'has_upper': True},
 868        #           3: {'has_lower': True, 'has_upper': False},
 869        #           4: {'has_lower': False, 'has_upper': True},
 870        #           5: {'has_lower': True, 'has_upper': False},
 871        #       }
 872
 873        index, attrs = meta_check(index, attrs, "typeOfProbability")
 874        if 'thresholdLowerLimit' not in index.columns:
 875            index = index.assign(thresholdLowerLimit=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.thresholdLowerLimit))
 876        if 'thresholdUpperLimit' not in index.columns:
 877            index = index.assign(thresholdUpperLimit=index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.thresholdUpperLimit))
 878        if 'threshold' not in index.columns:
 879            # using composite of lower and upper, but could use threshold string from grib2io as long as that is unique and based on lower and upper
 880            index = index.assign(threshold=list(zip(index['thresholdLowerLimit'], index['thresholdUpperLimit'])))
 881#           index = index.assign(threshold = index.msg.apply(lambda msg: msg.threshold))
 882
 883        # ommiting threshold results in no index being assigned for this possible dim
 884        dim_coords["threshold"] = ["thresholdLowerLimit", "thresholdUpperLimit"]
 885
 886    if pdtn in {6, 10}:
 887
 888        # Percentile forecasts at a horizontal level or in a horizontal layer
 889        # in a continuous or non-continuous time interval.  (see Template
 890        # 4.10)
 891        dim_coords["percentileValue"] = ["percentileValue"]
 892        coord_attrs["percentileValue"] = dict(long_name='percentile', units='percent')
 893
 894    if pdtn in {8, 9, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 42, 43, 45, 46, 47, 61, 62, 63, 67, 68, 72, 73, 78, 79, 82, 83, 84, 85, 87, 91}:
 895        dim_coords["duration"] = ["duration"]
 896
 897    if pdtn in {1, 11, 33, 34, 41, 43, 45, 47, 49, 54, 56, 58, 59, 63, 68, 77, 79, 81, 83, 84, 85, 92}:
 898        dim_coords["perturbationNumber"] = ["perturbationNumber"]
 899
 900    if pdtn in {2,3,4,12,13,14}:
 901        index, attrs = meta_check(index, attrs, 'typeOfDerivedForecast')
 902
 903    if pdtn in {8,15,42,46,62,67,72,78,82,1001,1002,1100,1101}:
 904        index, attrs = meta_check(index, attrs, 'statisticalProcess')
 905
 906    # Finish logic by pdtn
 907
 908    for k, v in dim_coords.items():
 909        for meta in v:
 910            if meta not in index.columns:
 911                index = index.assign(**{meta: index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, meta))})
 912
 913    return index, dim_coords, attrs, coord_attrs
 914
 915
 916# Custom open_datatree function to open grib files as DataTree
 917def open_datatree(filename, *, filters: typing.Mapping[str, typing.Any] = None, engine="grib2io"):
 918    """
 919    Open a GRIB2 file as an xarray DataTree.
 920
 921    Parameters
 922    ----------
 923    filename : str
 924        Path to the GRIB2 file.
 925    filters : dict, optional
 926        Filter criteria for GRIB2 messages.
 927    engine : str, optional
 928        Engine to use for opening the file, defaults to "grib2io".
 929
 930    Returns
 931    -------
 932    xarray.DataTree
 933        A hierarchical DataTree representation of the GRIB2 data.
 934    """
 935    if not HAS_DATATREE:
 936        raise ImportError("xarray version does not support DataTree functionality.")
 937
 938    if filters is None:
 939        filters = {}
 940
 941    # Open the file without any filters first to get all messages
 942    with grib2io.open(filename, _xarray_backend=True) as f:
 943        file_index = pd.DataFrame(f._index)
 944
 945    # Create a DataTree root
 946    tree = xr.DataTree()
 947
 948    # Build tree structure from GRIB messages
 949    return build_datatree_from_grib(filename, file_index, filters)
 950
 951
 952def build_da_without_coords(index, cube, filename, attrs) -> xr.DataArray:
 953    """
 954    Build a DataArray without coordinates from a cube of grib2 messages.
 955
 956    Parameters
 957    ----------
 958    index
 959        Index of cube.
 960    cube
 961        Cube of grib2 messages.
 962    filename
 963        Filename of grib2 file
 964    add_grib_section_attrs
 965        Include grib section arrays as dataArray attributes
 966
 967    Returns
 968    -------
 969    DataArray
 970        DataArray without coordinates
 971    """
 972
 973    dim_names = [k for k in cube.keys() if cube[k] is not None and len(cube[k]) > 1]
 974    constant_meta_names = [k for k in cube.keys() if cube[k] is None]
 975    dims = {k: len(cube[k]) for k in dim_names}
 976
 977    # guard against bad datarrays being formed
 978    dims_total = 1
 979    dims_to_filter = []
 980    for dim_name, dim_len, in dims.items():
 981        if dim_name not in {'x', 'y', 'station'}:
 982            dims_total *= dim_len
 983            dims_to_filter.append(dim_name)
 984
 985    # Check number of GRIB2 message indexed compared to non-X/Y
 986    # dimensions.
 987    if dims_total != len(index):
 988        raise ValueError(
 989            f"DataArray dimensions are not compatible with number of GRIB2 messages; DataArray has {dims_total} "
 990            f"and GRIB2 index has {len(index)}. Consider applying a filter for dimensions: {dims_to_filter}"
 991        )
 992
 993    data = OnDiskArray(filename, index, cube)
 994    lock = LOCK
 995    data = GribBackendArray(data, lock)
 996    data = indexing.LazilyIndexedArray(data)
 997    if len(dim_names) != len(data.shape):
 998        raise ValueError(
 999            "different number of dimensions on data "
1000            f"and dims: {len(data.shape)} vs {len(dim_names)}\n"
1001            "Grib2 messages could not be formed into a data cube; "
1002            "It's possible extra messages exist along a non-accounted for dimension based on PDTN\n"
1003            "It might be possible to get around this by applying a filter on the non-accounted for dimension"
1004        )
1005    da = xr.DataArray(data, dims=dim_names)
1006
1007    da.encoding['original_shape'] = data.shape
1008
1009    da.encoding['preferred_chunks'] = {'y': -1, 'x': -1}
1010    msg1 = index.msg.iloc[0]
1011
1012    # plain language metadata is minimized
1013    # add grib section metadata
1014    da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section0'] = msg1.section0
1015    da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section1'] = msg1.section1
1016    da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section2'] = msg1.section2 if msg1.section2 else []
1017    da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'] = msg1.section3
1018    da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section4'] = msg1.section4
1019    da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section5'] = msg1.section5
1020    da.attrs['fullName'] = str(msg1.fullName)
1021    da.attrs['shortName'] = str(msg1.shortName)
1022    da.attrs['units'] = str(msg1.units)
1023    da.attrs['originatingCenter'] = str(msg1.originatingCenter.definition)
1024    da.attrs['originatingSubCenter'] = str(msg1.originatingSubCenter.definition)
1025
1026    # add master table
1027    da.attrs['masterTableInfo'] = str(msg1.masterTableInfo.definition)
1028
1029    da.name = index.shortName.iloc[0]
1030    for meta_name in constant_meta_names:
1031        if meta_name in index.columns:
1032            da.attrs[meta_name] = index[meta_name].iloc[0]
1033
1034    da.attrs.update(attrs)
1035
1036    return da
1037
1038
1039def assign_xr_meta(ds, frames, cube, non_geo_dims, extra_geo, coord_attrs):
1040
1041    # assign coords from the cube; the cube prevents datarrays with
1042    # different shapes
1043    ds = ds.assign_coords(coords_from_cube(cube))
1044    # assign extra index associated coords
1045    df = frames[0]  # use first variable as they all have same shape and index metadata
1046    for dim_name, coord_names in non_geo_dims.items():
1047        retain_index_coord = False
1048        for name in coord_names:
1049            if name == dim_name:
1050                retain_index_coord = True
1051            else:
1052                if ds[dim_name].size == 1:
1053                    # for assigning scalar coords
1054                    coord_data = [df[name].unique().item()]
1055                    ds = ds.assign_coords({name: coord_data}).squeeze()
1056                else:
1057                    # "ValueError: can only convert an array of size 1 to a Python scalar" indicates the coord is not compatible with the index
1058                    coord_data = [df[df.index.get_level_values(f'{dim_name}_ix') == val][name].unique(
1059                    ).item() for val in range(ds[dim_name].size)]
1060                    coord = pd.Index(coord_data, name=dim_name)
1061                    ds = ds.assign_coords({name: coord})
1062        if not retain_index_coord:
1063            ds = ds.drop_vars(dim_name)
1064
1065    # assign extra geo coords
1066    ds = ds.assign_coords(extra_geo)
1067    # add crs data from first grib message to each data variable and the dataset
1068    geo_attrs = {
1069        'crs_wkt': CRS.from_dict(df.msg.iloc[0].projParameters).to_wkt(),
1070        'gridlengthXDirection': df.msg.iloc[0].gridlengthXDirection,
1071        'gridlengthYDirection': df.msg.iloc[0].gridlengthYDirection,
1072        'latitudeFirstGridpoint': df.msg.iloc[0].latitudeFirstGridpoint,
1073        'longitudeFirstGridpoint': df.msg.iloc[0].longitudeFirstGridpoint,
1074    }
1075    for data_var in ds.data_vars:
1076        ds[data_var].attrs.update(geo_attrs)
1077    ds.attrs.update(geo_attrs)
1078
1079    # add coordinate specific attributes
1080    for coord, attrs in coord_attrs.items():
1081        ds[coord].attrs.update(attrs)
1082
1083    # assign valid date coords
1084    ds = ds.assign_coords(dict(validDate=ds.coords['refDate']+ds.coords['leadTime']))
1085    ds.validDate.attrs['standard_name'] = 'time'
1086    ds.validDate.attrs['long_name'] = 'time'
1087
1088    # assign attributes
1089    ds.attrs['engine'] = 'grib2io'
1090
1091    return ds
1092
1093
1094def make_variables(index, f, non_geo_dims, allow_uneven_dims=False):
1095    """
1096    Create an individual dataframe index and cube for each variable.
1097
1098    Parameters
1099    ----------
1100    index
1101        Index of cube.
1102    f
1103        ?
1104    non_geo_dims
1105        Dimensions not associated with the x,y grid
1106    allow_uneven_dims
1107        If True, allows uneven dimensions (used for DataTree creation)
1108
1109    Returns
1110    -------
1111    ordered_frames
1112        List of dataframes, one for each variable.
1113    cube
1114        Cube of grib2 messages.
1115    extra_geo
1116        Extra geographic coordinates.
1117    """
1118    # let shortName determine the variables
1119
1120    # set the index to the name
1121    index = index.set_index('shortName').sort_index()
1122    # return nothing if no data
1123    if index.empty:
1124        return None, None, None
1125
1126    # define the DimCube
1127    dims = copy(non_geo_dims)
1128
1129    ordered_meta = list(non_geo_dims.keys())
1130    cube = None
1131    ordered_frames = list()
1132    for key in index.index.unique():
1133        frame = index.loc[[key]]
1134        frame = frame.reset_index()
1135        # frame is a dataframe with all records for one variable
1136        c = dict()
1137        # for colname in frame.columns:
1138        for colname in ordered_meta:
1139            uniques = pd.Index(frame[colname]).unique()
1140            if len(uniques) > 1:
1141                c[colname] = uniques.sort_values()
1142            else:
1143                c[colname] = [uniques[0]]
1144
1145        dims = [k for k in ordered_meta if len(c[k]) > 1]
1146
1147        for dim in dims:
1148            if frame[dim].value_counts().nunique() > 1 and not allow_uneven_dims:
1149                raise ValueError(
1150                    f'uneven number of grib msgs associated with dimension: {dim}\n unique values for {dim}: {frame[dim].unique()} ')
1151
1152        if len(dims) >= 1:  # dims may be empty if no extra dims on top of x,y
1153            frame = frame.sort_values(dims)
1154            frame = frame.set_index(dims)
1155
1156        if cube:
1157            if cube != c and not allow_uneven_dims:
1158                raise ValueError(f'{cube},\n {c};\n cubes are not the same; filter to a single cube')
1159        else:
1160            cube = c
1161
1162        # miloc is multi-index integer location of msg in nd DataArray
1163        miloc = list(zip(*[frame.index.unique(level=dim).get_indexer(frame.index.get_level_values(dim))
1164                     for dim in dims]))
1165
1166        # set frame multi index
1167        if len(miloc) >= 1:  # miloc will be empty when no extra dims, thus no multiindex
1168            dim_ix = tuple([n+'_ix' for n in dims])
1169            frame = frame.set_index(pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples(miloc, names=dim_ix))
1170
1171        ordered_frames.append(frame)
1172
1173    # no variables
1174    if cube is None:
1175        cube = dict()
1176
1177    # check geography of data and assign to cube
1178    if len(index.ny.unique()) > 1 or len(index.nx.unique()) > 1:
1179        raise ValueError('multiple grids not accommodated')
1180    cube["y"] = range(int(index.ny.iloc[0]))
1181    cube["x"] = range(int(index.nx.iloc[0]))
1182
1183    extra_geo = None
1184    msg = index.msg.iloc[0]
1185
1186    # we want the lat lons; make them via accessing a record; we are assuming
1187    # all records are the same grid because they have the same shape;
1188    # may want a unique grid identifier from grib2io to avoid assuming this
1189    latitude, longitude = msg.latlons()
1190    latitude = xr.DataArray(latitude, dims=['y', 'x'])
1191    latitude.attrs['standard_name'] = 'latitude'
1192    latitude.attrs['units'] = 'degrees_north'
1193    longitude = xr.DataArray(longitude, dims=['y', 'x'])
1194    longitude.attrs['standard_name'] = 'longitude'
1195    longitude.attrs['units'] = 'degrees_east'
1196    extra_geo = dict(latitude=latitude, longitude=longitude)
1197
1198    return ordered_frames, cube, extra_geo
1199
1200
1201def interp_nd(a, *, method, grid_def_in, grid_def_out, method_options=None, num_threads=1):
1202    front_shape = a.shape[:-2]
1203    a = a.reshape(-1, a.shape[-2], a.shape[-1])
1204    a = grib2io.interpolate(a, method, grid_def_in, grid_def_out, method_options=method_options,
1205                            num_threads=num_threads)
1206    a = a.reshape(front_shape + (a.shape[-2], a.shape[-1]))
1207    return a
1208
1209
1210def interp_nd_stations(a, *, method, grid_def_in, lats, lons, method_options=None, num_threads=1):
1211    front_shape = a.shape[:-2]
1212    a = a.reshape(-1, a.shape[-2], a.shape[-1])
1213    a = grib2io.interpolate_to_stations(a, method, grid_def_in, lats, lons, method_options=method_options,
1214                                        num_threads=num_threads)
1215    a = a.reshape(front_shape + (len(lats),))
1216    return a
1217

1219@xr.register_dataset_accessor("grib2io")
1220class Grib2ioDataSet:
1221
1222    def __init__(self, xarray_obj):
1223        self._obj = xarray_obj
1224
1225    def griddef(self):
1226        return Grib2GridDef.from_section3(self._obj[list(self._obj.data_vars)[0]].attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'])
1227
1228    def interp(self, method, grid_def_out, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xr.Dataset:
1229        # see interp method of class Grib2ioDataArray
1230        da = self._obj.to_array()
1231        da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'] = self._obj[list(self._obj.data_vars)[0]].attrs['GRIB2IO_section3']
1232        da = da.grib2io.interp(method, grid_def_out, method_options=method_options,
1233                               num_threads=num_threads)
1234        ds = da.to_dataset(dim='variable')
1235        return ds
1236
1237    def interp_to_stations(self, method, calls, lats, lons, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xr.Dataset:
1238        # see interp_to_stations method of class Grib2ioDataArray
1239        da = self._obj.to_array()
1240        da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'] = self._obj[list(self._obj.data_vars)[0]].attrs['GRIB2IO_section3']
1241        da = da.grib2io.interp_to_stations(method, calls, lats, lons, method_options=method_options,
1242                                           num_threads=num_threads)
1243        ds = da.to_dataset(dim='variable')
1244        return ds
1245
1246    def to_grib2(self, filename, mode: typing.Literal["x", "w", "a"] = "x"):
1247        """
1248        Write a DataSet to a grib2 file.
1249
1250        Parameters
1251        ----------
1252        filename
1253            Name of the grib2 file to write to.
1254        mode: {"x", "w", "a"}, optional, default="x"
1255            Persistence mode
1256
1257            +------+-----------------------------------+
1258            | mode | Description                       |
1259            +======+===================================+
1260            | x    | create (fail if exists)           |
1261            +------+-----------------------------------+
1262            | w    | create (overwrite if exists)      |
1263            +------+-----------------------------------+
1264            | a    | append (create if does not exist) |
1265            +------+-----------------------------------+
1266
1267        """
1268        ds = self._obj
1269
1270        for shortName in sorted(ds):
1271            # make a DataArray from the "Data Variables" in the DataSet
1272            da = ds[shortName]
1273
1274            da.grib2io.to_grib2(filename, mode=mode)
1275            mode = "a"

1277    def update_attrs(self, **kwargs):
1278        """
1279        Raises an error because Datasets don't have a .attrs attribute.
1280
1281        Parameters
1282        ----------
1283        attrs
1284            Attributes to update.
1285        """
1286        raise ValueError(
1287            f"Datasets do not have a .attrs attribute; use .grib2io.update_attrs({kwargs}) on a DataArray instead."
1288        )

1290    def subset(self, lats, lons) -> xr.Dataset:
1291        """
1292        Subset the DataSet to a region defined by latitudes and longitudes.
1293
1294        Parameters
1295        ----------
1296        lats
1297            Latitude bounds of the region.
1298        lons
1299            Longitude bounds of the region.
1300
1301        Returns
1302        -------
1303        subset
1304            DataSet subset to the region.
1305        """
1306        ds = self._obj
1307
1308        newds = xr.Dataset()
1309        for shortName in ds:
1310            newds[shortName] = ds[shortName].grib2io.subset(lats, lons).copy()
1311
1312        return newds

1314
1315@xr.register_dataarray_accessor("grib2io")
1316class Grib2ioDataArray:
1317
1318    def __init__(self, xarray_obj):
1319        self._obj = xarray_obj
1320
1321    def griddef(self):
1322        return Grib2GridDef.from_section3(self._obj.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'])
1323
1324    def interp(self, method, grid_def_out, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xr.DataArray:
1325        """
1326        Perform grid spatial interpolation.
1327
1328        Uses the [NCEPLIBS-ip library](https://github.com/NOAA-EMC/NCEPLIBS-ip).
1329
1330        Parameters
1331        ----------
1332        method
1333            Interpolate method to use. This can either be an integer or string
1334            using the following mapping:
1335
1336            | Interpolate Scheme | Integer Value |
1337            | :---:              | :---:         |
1338            | 'bilinear'         | 0             |
1339            | 'bicubic'          | 1             |
1340            | 'neighbor'         | 2             |
1341            | 'budget'           | 3             |
1342            | 'spectral'         | 4             |
1343            | 'neighbor-budget'  | 6             |
1344        grid_def_out
1345            Grib2GridDef object of the output grid.
1346        method_options : list of ints, optional
1347            Interpolation options. See the NCEPLIBS-ip documentation for
1348            more information on how these are used.
1349        num_threads : int, optional
1350            Number of OpenMP threads to use for interpolation. The default
1351            value is 1. If grib2io_interp was not built with OpenMP, then
1352            this keyword argument and value will have no impact.
1353
1354        Returns
1355        -------
1356        interp
1357            DataSet interpolated to new grid definition.  The attribute
1358            GRIB2IO_section3 is replaced with the section3 array from the new
1359            grid definition.
1360        """
1361        da = self._obj
1362        # ensure that y, x are rightmost dims; they should be if opening with
1363        # grib2io engine
1364
1365        # gdtn and gdt is not the entirety of the new s3
1366        npoints = grid_def_out.npoints
1367        s3_new = np.array([0, npoints, 0, 0, grid_def_out.gdtn] + list(grid_def_out.gdt))
1368
1369        # make new lat lons
1370        lats, lons = Grib2Message(section3=s3_new, pdtn=0, drtn=0).grid()
1371        latitude = xr.DataArray(lats, dims=['y', 'x'])
1372        longitude = xr.DataArray(lons, dims=['y', 'x'])
1373
1374        # create new coords
1375        new_coords = dict(da.coords)
1376        del new_coords['latitude']
1377        del new_coords['longitude']
1378        new_coords['longitude'] = longitude
1379        new_coords['latitude'] = latitude
1380
1381        # make grid def in from section3 on da.attrs
1382        grid_def_in = self.griddef()
1383
1384        if da.chunks is None:
1385            data = interp_nd(da.data, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1386                             grid_def_out=grid_def_out,
1387                             method_options=method_options, num_threads=num_threads)
1388        else:
1389            import dask
1390            front_shape = da.shape[:-2]
1391            data = da.data.map_blocks(interp_nd, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1392                                      grid_def_out=grid_def_out, method_options=method_options,
1393                                      chunks=da.chunks[:-2]+latitude.shape, dtype=da.dtype)
1394
1395        new_da = xr.DataArray(data, dims=da.dims, coords=new_coords, attrs=da.attrs)
1396
1397        new_da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'] = s3_new
1398        new_da.name = da.name
1399        return new_da
1400
1401    def interp_to_stations(self, method, calls, lats, lons, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xr.DataArray:
1402        """
1403        Perform spatial interpolation to station points.
1404
1405        Parameters
1406        ----------
1407        method
1408            Interpolate method to use. This can either be an integer or string
1409            using the following mapping:
1410
1411            | Interpolate Scheme | Integer Value |
1412            | :---:              | :---:         |
1413            | 'bilinear'         | 0             |
1414            | 'bicubic'          | 1             |
1415            | 'neighbor'         | 2             |
1416            | 'budget'           | 3             |
1417            | 'spectral'         | 4             |
1418            | 'neighbor-budget'  | 6             |
1419
1420        calls
1421            Station calls used for labeling new station index coordinate
1422        lats
1423            Latitudes of the station points.
1424        lons
1425            Longitudes of the station points.
1426
1427        Returns
1428        -------
1429        interp_to_stations
1430            DataArray interpolated to lat and lon locations and labeled with
1431            dimension and coordinate 'station'. (..., y, x) -> (..., station)
1432        """
1433        da = self._obj
1434        # TODO ensure that y, x are rightmost dims; they should be if opening
1435        # with grib2io engine
1436
1437        calls = np.asarray(calls)
1438        lats = np.asarray(lats)
1439        lons = np.asarray(lons)
1440        latitude = xr.DataArray(lats, dims=['station'])
1441        longitude = xr.DataArray(lons, dims=['station'])
1442
1443        # create new coords
1444        new_coords = dict(da.coords)
1445        del new_coords['latitude']
1446        del new_coords['longitude']
1447        new_coords['longitude'] = longitude
1448        new_coords['latitude'] = latitude
1449        new_coords['station'] = calls
1450
1451        new_dims = da.dims[:-2] + ('station',)
1452
1453        # make grid def in from section3 on da attrs
1454        grid_def_in = self.griddef()
1455
1456        if da.chunks is None:
1457            data = interp_nd_stations(da.data, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in, lats=lats,
1458                                      lons=lons, method_options=method_options, num_threads=num_threads)
1459        else:
1460            import dask
1461            front_shape = da.shape[:-1]
1462            data = da.data.map_blocks(interp_nd_stations, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1463                                      lats=lats, lons=lons, method_options=method_options,
1464                                      drop_axis=-1, chunks=da.chunks[:-2]+latitude.shape,
1465                                      dtype=da.dtype)
1466
1467        new_da = xr.DataArray(data, dims=new_dims, coords=new_coords, attrs=da.attrs)
1468
1469        new_da.name = da.name
1470        return new_da
1471
1472    def to_grib2(self, filename, mode: typing.Literal["x", "w", "a"] = "x"):
1473        """
1474        Write a DataArray to a grib2 file.
1475
1476        Parameters
1477        ----------
1478        filename
1479            Name of the grib2 file to write to.
1480        mode: {"x", "w", "a"}, optional, default="x"
1481            Persistence mode
1482
1483            +------+-----------------------------------+
1484            | mode | Description                       |
1485            +======+===================================+
1486            | x    | create (fail if exists)           |
1487            +------+-----------------------------------+
1488            | w    | create (overwrite if exists)      |
1489            +------+-----------------------------------+
1490            | a    | append (create if does not exist) |
1491            +------+-----------------------------------+
1492
1493        """
1494        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1495
1496        coords_keys = sorted(da.coords.keys())
1497        coords_keys = [k for k in coords_keys if k in AVAILABLE_NON_GEO_COORDS]
1498
1499        # If there are dimension coordinates, the DataArray is a hypercube of
1500        # grib2 messages.
1501
1502        # Create `indexes` which is a list of lists of dictionaries for all
1503        # dimension coordinates. Each dictionary key is the dimension
1504        # coordinate name and the value is a list of the dimension coordinate
1505        # values.  This allows for easy iteration over all possible grib2
1506        # messages in the DataArray by using itertools.product.
1507        #
1508        # For example:
1509        # indexes = [
1510        #     [
1511        #         {"leadTime": 9},
1512        #         {"leadTime": 12},
1513        #     ],
1514        #     [
1515        #         {"valueOfFirstFixedSurface": 900},
1516        #         {"valueOfFirstFixedSurface": 925},
1517        #         {"valueOfFirstFixedSurface": 950},
1518        #     ],
1519        # ]
1520
1521        # assign loc indexes to dimensions without indexes for uniform selection by name
1522        loc_indexes = list()
1523        for dim in da.dims:
1524            if dim not in da.indexes:
1525                da = da.assign_coords({dim: range(da[dim].size)})
1526                loc_indexes.append(dim)
1527
1528        indexes = []
1529        for index in [i for i in AVAILABLE_NON_GEO_DIMS if i in da.dims]:
1530            values = da.coords[index].values
1531            if len(values) != len(set(values)):
1532                raise ValueError(
1533                    f"Dimension coordinate '{index}' has duplicate values, but to_grib2 requires unique values to find each GRIB2 message in the DataArray."
1534                )
1535            listeach = [{index: value} for value in sorted(values)]
1536            indexes.append(listeach)
1537
1538        # If `dim_coords` is [], then the DataArray is a single grib2 message and
1539        # itertools.product(*dim_coords) will run once with `selectors = ()`.
1540        for selectors in itertools.product(*indexes):
1541            # Need to find the correct data in the DataArray based on the
1542            # dimension coordinates.
1543            filters = {k: v for d in selectors for k, v in d.items()}
1544
1545            # If `filters` is {}, then the DataArray is a single grib2 message
1546            # and da.sel(indexers={}) returns the DataArray.
1547            selected = da.sel(indexers=filters)
1548
1549            newmsg = Grib2Message(
1550                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1551                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1552                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1553                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1554                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1555                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1556            )
1557            newmsg.data = np.array(selected.data)
1558
1559            # For dimension coordinates, set the grib2 message metadata to the
1560            # dimension coordinate value.
1561            for index, value in filters.items():
1562                if index not in loc_indexes:
1563                    setattr(newmsg, index, value)
1564
1565            # For non-dimension coordinates, set the grib2 message metadata to
1566            # the DataArray coordinate value.
1567            for index in [i for i in coords_keys if i not in da.dims]:
1568                setattr(newmsg, index, selected.coords[index].values)
1569
1570            # Set section 5 attributes to the da.encoding dictionary.
1571            for key, value in selected.encoding.items():
1572                if key in ["dtype", "chunks", "original_shape"]:
1573                    continue
1574                setattr(newmsg, key, value)
1575
1576            # write the message to file
1577            with grib2io.open(filename, mode=mode) as f:
1578                f.write(newmsg)
1579            mode = "a"
1580
1581    def update_attrs(self, **kwargs):
1582        """
1583        Update many of the attributes of the DataArray.
1584
1585        Parameters
1586        ----------
1587        **kwargs
1588            Attributes to update.  This can include many of the GRIB2IO message
1589            attributes that you can find when you print a GRIB2IO message. For
1590            conflicting updates, the last keyword will be used.
1591
1592            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1593            | kwargs                | Description                              |
1594            +=======================+==========================================+
1595            | shortName="VTMP"      | Set shortName to "VTMP", along with      |
1596            |                       | appropriate discipline,                  |
1597            |                       | parameterCategory, parameterNumber,      |
1598            |                       | fullName and units.                      |
1599            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1600            | discipline=0,         | Set shortName, discipline,               |
1601            | parameterCategory=0,  | parameterCategory, parameterNumber,      |
1602            | parameterNumber=1     | fullName and units appropriate for       |
1603            |                       | "Virtual Temperature".                   |
1604            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1605            | discipline=0,         | Conflicting keywords but                 |
1606            | parameterCategory=0,  | 'shortName="TMP"' wins.  Set shortName,  |
1607            | parameterNumber=1,    | discipline, parameterCategory,           |
1608            | shortName="TMP"       | parameterNumber, fullName and units      |
1609            |                       | appropriate for "Temperature".           |
1610            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1611
1612        Returns
1613        -------
1614        DataArray
1615            DataArray with updated attributes.
1616        """
1617        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1618
1619        newmsg = Grib2Message(
1620            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1621            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1622            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1623            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1624            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1625            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1626        )
1627
1628        coords_keys = [
1629            k
1630            for k in da.coords.keys()
1631            if k in AVAILABLE_NON_GEO_COORDS
1632        ]
1633
1634        for grib2_name, value in kwargs.items():
1635            if grib2_name == "gridDefinitionTemplateNumber":
1636                raise ValueError(
1637                    "The gridDefinitionTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated.  The best way to change to a different grid is to interpolate the data to a new grid using the grib2io interpolate functions."
1638                )
1639            if grib2_name == "productDefinitionTemplateNumber":
1640                raise ValueError(
1641                    "The productDefinitionTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated."
1642                )
1643            if grib2_name == "dataRepresentationTemplateNumber":
1644                raise ValueError(
1645                    "The dataRepresentationTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated."
1646                )
1647            if grib2_name in coords_keys:
1648                warnings.warn(
1649                    f"Skipping attribute '{grib2_name}' because it is a coordinate. Use da.assign_coords() to change coordinate values."
1650                )
1651                continue
1652            if hasattr(newmsg, grib2_name):
1653                setattr(newmsg, grib2_name, value)
1654            else:
1655                warnings.warn(
1656                    f"Skipping attribute '{grib2_name}' because it is not a valid GRIB2 attribute for this message and cannot be updated."
1657                )
1658                continue
1659
1660        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"] = newmsg.section0
1661        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"] = newmsg.section1
1662        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"] = newmsg.section2 or []
1663        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"] = newmsg.section3
1664        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"] = newmsg.section4
1665        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"] = newmsg.section5
1666        da.attrs["fullName"] = newmsg.fullName
1667        da.attrs["shortName"] = newmsg.shortName
1668        da.attrs["units"] = newmsg.units
1669
1670        return da
1671
1672    def subset(self, lats, lons) -> xr.DataArray:
1673        """
1674        Subset the DataArray to a region defined by latitudes and longitudes.
1675
1676        Parameters
1677        ----------
1678        lats
1679            Latitude bounds of the region.
1680        lons
1681            Longitude bounds of the region.
1682
1683        Returns
1684        -------
1685        subset
1686            DataArray subset to the region.
1687        """
1688        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1689
1690        newmsg = Grib2Message(
1691            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1692            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1693            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1694            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1695            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1696            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1697        )
1698        newmsg.data = np.copy(da.values)
1699
1700        newmsg = newmsg.subset(lats, lons)
1701
1702        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"] = newmsg.section3
1703
1704        mask_lat = (da.latitude >= newmsg.latitudeLastGridpoint) & (
1705            da.latitude <= newmsg.latitudeFirstGridpoint
1706        )
1707        mask_lon = (da.longitude >= newmsg.longitudeFirstGridpoint) & (
1708            da.longitude <= newmsg.longitudeLastGridpoint
1709        )
1710
1711        return da.where((mask_lon & mask_lat).compute(), drop=True)
1712
1713
1714def build_datatree_from_grib(filename, file_index, filters=None, stack_vertical=False):
1715    """
1716    Build a DataTree from GRIB2 messages.
1717
1718    Parameters
1719    ----------
1720    filename : str
1721        Path to the GRIB2 file.
1722    file_index : pandas.DataFrame
1723        DataFrame of GRIB2 message index.
1724    filters : dict, optional
1725        Filter criteria for GRIB2 messages.
1726    stack_vertical : bool, optional
1727        If True, vertical levels will be stacked in a single dataset
1728        instead of being organized in separate tree nodes.
1729
1730    Returns
1731    -------
1732    xarray.DataTree
1733        A hierarchical DataTree representation of the GRIB2 data.
1734    """
1735    if filters is None:
1736        filters = {}
1737
1738    # Apply any filters from user
1739    for k, v in filters.items():
1740        if k not in file_index.columns:
1741            file_index = file_index.copy()
1742            file_index[k] = file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, k, None))
1743        file_index = filter_index(file_index, k, v)
1744
1745    # Make a copy to avoid the SettingWithCopyWarning
1746    file_index = file_index.copy()
1747
1748    # Extract metadata needed for tree organization
1749    # Use a safer approach to handle missing attributes
1750    def safe_getattr(obj, name):
1751        try:
1752            attr = getattr(obj, name)
1753            # Need to test if the attribute is Grib2Metadata. If so,
1754            # then get the value attribute.
1755            if isinstance(attr, grib2io.templates.Grib2Metadata):
1756                attr = attr.value
1757            return attr
1758        except (AttributeError, KeyError):
1759            return None
1760
1761    for attr in TREE_HIERARCHY_LEVELS:
1762        if (attr not in file_index.columns) and (attr != 'valueOfFirstFixedSurface'):
1763            file_index[attr] = file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: safe_getattr(msg, attr))
1764
1765    # Also extract shortName for variable naming
1766    if 'shortName' not in file_index.columns:
1767        file_index = file_index.assign(shortName=file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, 'shortName', None)))
1768        file_index = file_index.assign(nx=file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, 'nx', None)))
1769        file_index = file_index.assign(ny=file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, 'ny', None)))
1770
1771    # Create root DataTree
1772    root = xr.DataTree()
1773
1774    # Adjust hierarchy levels if we're stacking vertical levels
1775    hierarchy_levels = list(TREE_HIERARCHY_LEVELS)
1776    if stack_vertical and "valueOfFirstFixedSurface" in hierarchy_levels:
1777        hierarchy_levels.remove("valueOfFirstFixedSurface")
1778
1779    # First group by level type
1780    level_groups = {}
1781
1782    # Create a dictionary to group data by level type
1783    for level_type in file_index['typeOfFirstFixedSurface'].unique():
1784        if pd.notna(level_type):  # Skip None/NaN values
1785            level_info = LEVEL_NAME_MAPPING.get(level_type, f"level_{level_type}")
1786            level_name = level_info[0]
1787            level_source = level_info[1]
1788            # Get all rows for this level type
1789            level_data = file_index[file_index['typeOfFirstFixedSurface'] == level_type]
1790            level_groups[level_type] = {'name': level_name, 'data': level_data}
1791
1792    # Process each level group
1793    for level_type, group_info in level_groups.items():
1794        level_name = group_info['name']
1795        level_df = group_info['data']
1796
1797        # Create a branch for this level type
1798        level_tree = xr.DataTree()
1799
1800        # Process this branch based on PDTN, perturbation number, etc.
1801        process_level_branch(level_tree, level_df, filename)
1802
1803        # Add this branch to the main tree
1804        root[level_name] = level_tree
1805
1806    return root
1807
1808
1809def process_level_branch(level_tree, df, filename):
1810    """
1811    Process a level type branch of the data tree, organizing by PDTN and other attributes.
1812
1813    Parameters
1814    ----------
1815    level_tree : xarray.DataTree
1816        The DataTree node for this level type
1817    df : pandas.DataFrame
1818        DataFrame of messages for this level type
1819    filename : str
1820        Path to the GRIB2 file
1821    """
1822    # Group by PDTN
1823    pdtn_groups = {}
1824
1825    # Group data by PDTN first
1826    for pdtn_value in df['productDefinitionTemplateNumber'].unique():
1827        if pd.notna(pdtn_value):
1828            pdtn_df = df[df['productDefinitionTemplateNumber'] == pdtn_value]
1829            pdtn_groups[pdtn_value] = pdtn_df
1830
1831    # If there's only one PDTN value, skip creating PDTN branch level
1832    if len(pdtn_groups) == 1:
1833        pdtn, pdtn_df = next(iter(pdtn_groups.items()))
1834
1835        pdtn_name = f"pdtn_{int(pdtn)}"
1836
1837        # Check if we need to further subdivide by perturbation number
1838        has_perturbations = ('perturbationNumber' in pdtn_df.columns and
1839                             len(pdtn_df['perturbationNumber'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1840
1841        # Check if we need to further subdivide by probabilities unique for each variable.
1842        has_probabilities = ('typeOfProbability' in pdtn_df.columns and
1843                             len(pdtn_df['typeOfProbability'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1844
1845        if has_perturbations:
1846            # Process perturbations directly on the level tree
1847            process_perturbation_groups(level_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1848        elif has_probabilities:
1849            # Process probability groups
1850            process_probability_groups(level_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1851        else:
1852            # Try to create dataset directly on level
1853            try:
1854                dss = create_datasets_from_df(pdtn_df, filename)
1855                if dss is not None:
1856                    dt = xr.DataTree()
1857                    if len(dss) == 1:
1858                        dt.ds = dss[0]
1859                    else:
1860                        for ds in dss:
1861                            varname = list(ds.data_vars)[0]
1862                            dt[f"var_{varname}"] = ds
1863                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = dt
1864            except Exception as e:
1865                print(f"Error creating dataset for level with pdtn {int(pdtn)}: {e}")
1866
1867                # Try to separate by variable name as a fallback
1868                try_process_by_variables(level_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1869    else:
1870        # Multiple PDTN values, process each group with PDTN branch nodes
1871        for pdtn, pdtn_df in pdtn_groups.items():
1872            # Use a simple node name that's easy to use in code
1873            pdtn_name = f"pdtn_{int(pdtn)}"
1874
1875            # Check if we need to further subdivide by perturbation number
1876            has_perturbations = ('perturbationNumber' in pdtn_df.columns and
1877                                 len(pdtn_df['perturbationNumber'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1878
1879            # Check if we need to further subdivide by probabilities unique for each variable.
1880            has_probabilities = ('typeOfProbability' in pdtn_df.columns and
1881                                 len(pdtn_df['typeOfProbability'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1882
1883            if has_perturbations:
1884                # Create a branch for this PDTN
1885                pdtn_tree = xr.DataTree()
1886
1887                # Process perturbation groups
1888                process_perturbation_groups(pdtn_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1889
1890                # Only add the PDTN branch if it has children
1891                if len(pdtn_tree.children) > 0 or pdtn_tree.ds is not None:
1892                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree
1893            elif has_probabilities:
1894                # Create a branch for this PDTN
1895                pdtn_tree = xr.DataTree()
1896
1897                # Process probability groups
1898                process_probability_groups(pdtn_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1899
1900                # Only add the PDTN branch if it has children
1901                if len(pdtn_tree.children) > 0 or pdtn_tree.ds is not None:
1902                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree
1903            else:
1904                # Create a subtree for this PDTN
1905                pdtn_tree = xr.DataTree()
1906
1907                # Try to create dataset directly on level
1908                try:
1909                    dss = create_datasets_from_df(pdtn_df, filename)
1910                    if dss is not None:
1911                        if len(dss) == 1:
1912                            pdtn_tree.ds = dss[0]
1913                        else:
1914                            for ds in dss:
1915                                varname = list(ds.data_vars)[0]
1916                                pdtn_tree[f"var_{varname}"] = ds
1917                        level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree
1918                except Exception as e:
1919                    print(f"Error creating dataset for level with pdtn {int(pdtn)}: {e}")
1920
1921                    # Try to separate by variable name as a fallback
1922                    try_process_by_variables(pdtn_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1923                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree
1924
1925
1926def process_probability_groups(target_tree, pdtn_df, filename):
1927    """
1928    """
1929    success = False
1930    # Group by type of probability
1931    prob_groups = {}
1932    for prob_value in pdtn_df['typeOfProbability'].unique():
1933        if pd.notna(prob_value):
1934            prob_df = pdtn_df[pdtn_df['typeOfProbability'] == prob_value]
1935            prob_groups[prob_value] = prob_df
1936
1937    # Process each probability group
1938    prob_dict = {}
1939    for prob_num, prob_df in prob_groups.items():
1940        prob_name = f"prob_{int(prob_num)}"
1941
1942        # Try to create dataset for this probability group
1943        try:
1944            dss = create_datasets_from_df(prob_df, filename)
1945            dt = xr.DataTree()
1946            if len(dss) == 1:
1947                dt.ds = dss[0]
1948                target_tree[prob_name] = dt
1949            elif len(dss) > 1:
1950                for ds in dss:
1951                    dt[f"var_{ds.data_vars[0]}"] = ds
1952            target_tree[prob_name] = dt
1953        except Exception as e:
1954            # Log error but continue processing other groups
1955            print(f"Error creating dataset for type of probability {prob_name}: {e}")
1956
1957    return success

1970    filename : str

1978    success = False

1984            pert_groups[pert_value] = pert_df
1985
1986    # Process each perturbation group
1987    for pert_num, pert_df in pert_groups.items():
1988        pert_name = f"pert_{int(pert_num)}"
1989
1990        ## Try to create dataset for this perturbation group
1991        #try:

1993        #    if dss is not None:

1996        #        else:

1998        #            atree = xr.DataTree(dss_dict)

2000        #        success = True
2001        #except Exception as e:

2004
