@xr.register_dataarray_accessor('grib2io')
class Grib2ioDataArray: 
1316@xr.register_dataarray_accessor("grib2io")
1317class Grib2ioDataArray:
1318
1319    def __init__(self, xarray_obj):
1320        self._obj = xarray_obj
1321
1322    def griddef(self):
1323        return Grib2GridDef.from_section3(self._obj.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'])
1324
1325    def interp(self, method, grid_def_out, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xr.DataArray:
1326        """
1327        Perform grid spatial interpolation.
1328
1329        Uses the [NCEPLIBS-ip library](https://github.com/NOAA-EMC/NCEPLIBS-ip).
1330
1331        Parameters
1332        ----------
1333        method
1334            Interpolate method to use. This can either be an integer or string
1335            using the following mapping:
1336
1337            | Interpolate Scheme | Integer Value |
1338            | :---:              | :---:         |
1339            | 'bilinear'         | 0             |
1340            | 'bicubic'          | 1             |
1341            | 'neighbor'         | 2             |
1342            | 'budget'           | 3             |
1343            | 'spectral'         | 4             |
1344            | 'neighbor-budget'  | 6             |
1345        grid_def_out
1346            Grib2GridDef object of the output grid.
1347        method_options : list of ints, optional
1348            Interpolation options. See the NCEPLIBS-ip documentation for
1349            more information on how these are used.
1350        num_threads : int, optional
1351            Number of OpenMP threads to use for interpolation. The default
1352            value is 1. If grib2io_interp was not built with OpenMP, then
1353            this keyword argument and value will have no impact.
1354
1355        Returns
1356        -------
1357        interp
1358            DataSet interpolated to new grid definition.  The attribute
1359            GRIB2IO_section3 is replaced with the section3 array from the new
1360            grid definition.
1361        """
1362        da = self._obj
1363        # ensure that y, x are rightmost dims; they should be if opening with
1364        # grib2io engine
1365
1366        # gdtn and gdt is not the entirety of the new s3
1367        npoints = grid_def_out.npoints
1368        s3_new = np.array([0, npoints, 0, 0, grid_def_out.gdtn] + list(grid_def_out.gdt))
1369
1370        # make new lat lons
1371        lats, lons = Grib2Message(section3=s3_new, pdtn=0, drtn=0).grid()
1372        latitude = xr.DataArray(lats, dims=['y', 'x'])
1373        longitude = xr.DataArray(lons, dims=['y', 'x'])
1374
1375        # create new coords
1376        new_coords = dict(da.coords)
1377        del new_coords['latitude']
1378        del new_coords['longitude']
1379        new_coords['longitude'] = longitude
1380        new_coords['latitude'] = latitude
1381
1382        # make grid def in from section3 on da.attrs
1383        grid_def_in = self.griddef()
1384
1385        if da.chunks is None:
1386            data = interp_nd(da.data, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1387                             grid_def_out=grid_def_out,
1388                             method_options=method_options, num_threads=num_threads)
1389        else:
1390            import dask
1391            front_shape = da.shape[:-2]
1392            data = da.data.map_blocks(interp_nd, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1393                                      grid_def_out=grid_def_out, method_options=method_options,
1394                                      chunks=da.chunks[:-2]+latitude.shape, dtype=da.dtype)
1395
1396        new_da = xr.DataArray(data, dims=da.dims, coords=new_coords, attrs=da.attrs)
1397
1398        new_da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'] = s3_new
1399        new_da.name = da.name
1400        return new_da
1401
1402    def interp_to_stations(self, method, calls, lats, lons, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xr.DataArray:
1403        """
1404        Perform spatial interpolation to station points.
1405
1406        Parameters
1407        ----------
1408        method
1409            Interpolate method to use. This can either be an integer or string
1410            using the following mapping:
1411
1412            | Interpolate Scheme | Integer Value |
1413            | :---:              | :---:         |
1414            | 'bilinear'         | 0             |
1415            | 'bicubic'          | 1             |
1416            | 'neighbor'         | 2             |
1417            | 'budget'           | 3             |
1418            | 'spectral'         | 4             |
1419            | 'neighbor-budget'  | 6             |
1420
1421        calls
1422            Station calls used for labeling new station index coordinate
1423        lats
1424            Latitudes of the station points.
1425        lons
1426            Longitudes of the station points.
1427
1428        Returns
1429        -------
1430        interp_to_stations
1431            DataArray interpolated to lat and lon locations and labeled with
1432            dimension and coordinate 'station'. (..., y, x) -> (..., station)
1433        """
1434        da = self._obj
1435        # TODO ensure that y, x are rightmost dims; they should be if opening
1436        # with grib2io engine
1437
1438        calls = np.asarray(calls)
1439        lats = np.asarray(lats)
1440        lons = np.asarray(lons)
1441        latitude = xr.DataArray(lats, dims=['station'])
1442        longitude = xr.DataArray(lons, dims=['station'])
1443
1444        # create new coords
1445        new_coords = dict(da.coords)
1446        del new_coords['latitude']
1447        del new_coords['longitude']
1448        new_coords['longitude'] = longitude
1449        new_coords['latitude'] = latitude
1450        new_coords['station'] = calls
1451
1452        new_dims = da.dims[:-2] + ('station',)
1453
1454        # make grid def in from section3 on da attrs
1455        grid_def_in = self.griddef()
1456
1457        if da.chunks is None:
1458            data = interp_nd_stations(da.data, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in, lats=lats,
1459                                      lons=lons, method_options=method_options, num_threads=num_threads)
1460        else:
1461            import dask
1462            front_shape = da.shape[:-1]
1463            data = da.data.map_blocks(interp_nd_stations, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1464                                      lats=lats, lons=lons, method_options=method_options,
1465                                      drop_axis=-1, chunks=da.chunks[:-2]+latitude.shape,
1466                                      dtype=da.dtype)
1467
1468        new_da = xr.DataArray(data, dims=new_dims, coords=new_coords, attrs=da.attrs)
1469
1470        new_da.name = da.name
1471        return new_da
1472
1473    def to_grib2(self, filename, mode: typing.Literal["x", "w", "a"] = "x"):
1474        """
1475        Write a DataArray to a grib2 file.
1476
1477        Parameters
1478        ----------
1479        filename
1480            Name of the grib2 file to write to.
1481        mode: {"x", "w", "a"}, optional, default="x"
1482            Persistence mode
1483
1484            +------+-----------------------------------+
1485            | mode | Description                       |
1486            +======+===================================+
1487            | x    | create (fail if exists)           |
1488            +------+-----------------------------------+
1489            | w    | create (overwrite if exists)      |
1490            +------+-----------------------------------+
1491            | a    | append (create if does not exist) |
1492            +------+-----------------------------------+
1493
1494        """
1495        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1496
1497        coords_keys = sorted(da.coords.keys())
1498        coords_keys = [k for k in coords_keys if k in AVAILABLE_NON_GEO_COORDS]
1499
1500        # If there are dimension coordinates, the DataArray is a hypercube of
1501        # grib2 messages.
1502
1503        # Create `indexes` which is a list of lists of dictionaries for all
1504        # dimension coordinates. Each dictionary key is the dimension
1505        # coordinate name and the value is a list of the dimension coordinate
1506        # values.  This allows for easy iteration over all possible grib2
1507        # messages in the DataArray by using itertools.product.
1508        #
1509        # For example:
1510        # indexes = [
1511        #     [
1512        #         {"leadTime": 9},
1513        #         {"leadTime": 12},
1514        #     ],
1515        #     [
1516        #         {"valueOfFirstFixedSurface": 900},
1517        #         {"valueOfFirstFixedSurface": 925},
1518        #         {"valueOfFirstFixedSurface": 950},
1519        #     ],
1520        # ]
1521
1522        # assign loc indexes to dimensions without indexes for uniform selection by name
1523        loc_indexes = list()
1524        for dim in da.dims:
1525            if dim not in da.indexes:
1526                da = da.assign_coords({dim: range(da[dim].size)})
1527                loc_indexes.append(dim)
1528
1529        indexes = []
1530        for index in [i for i in AVAILABLE_NON_GEO_DIMS if i in da.dims]:
1531            values = da.coords[index].values
1532            if len(values) != len(set(values)):
1533                raise ValueError(
1534                    f"Dimension coordinate '{index}' has duplicate values, but to_grib2 requires unique values to find each GRIB2 message in the DataArray."
1535                )
1536            listeach = [{index: value} for value in sorted(values)]
1537            indexes.append(listeach)
1538
1539        # If `dim_coords` is [], then the DataArray is a single grib2 message and
1540        # itertools.product(*dim_coords) will run once with `selectors = ()`.
1541        for selectors in itertools.product(*indexes):
1542            # Need to find the correct data in the DataArray based on the
1543            # dimension coordinates.
1544            filters = {k: v for d in selectors for k, v in d.items()}
1545
1546            # If `filters` is {}, then the DataArray is a single grib2 message
1547            # and da.sel(indexers={}) returns the DataArray.
1548            selected = da.sel(indexers=filters)
1549
1550            newmsg = Grib2Message(
1551                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1552                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1553                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1554                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1555                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1556                selected.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1557            )
1558            newmsg.data = np.array(selected.data)
1559
1560            # For dimension coordinates, set the grib2 message metadata to the
1561            # dimension coordinate value.
1562            for index, value in filters.items():
1563                if index not in loc_indexes:
1564                    setattr(newmsg, index, value)
1565
1566            # For non-dimension coordinates, set the grib2 message metadata to
1567            # the DataArray coordinate value.
1568            for index in [i for i in coords_keys if i not in da.dims]:
1569                setattr(newmsg, index, selected.coords[index].values)
1570
1571            # Set section 5 attributes to the da.encoding dictionary.
1572            for key, value in selected.encoding.items():
1573                if key in ["dtype", "chunks", "original_shape"]:
1574                    continue
1575                setattr(newmsg, key, value)
1576
1577            # write the message to file
1578            with grib2io.open(filename, mode=mode) as f:
1579                f.write(newmsg)
1580            mode = "a"
1581
1582    def update_attrs(self, **kwargs):
1583        """
1584        Update many of the attributes of the DataArray.
1585
1586        Parameters
1587        ----------
1588        **kwargs
1589            Attributes to update.  This can include many of the GRIB2IO message
1590            attributes that you can find when you print a GRIB2IO message. For
1591            conflicting updates, the last keyword will be used.
1592
1593            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1594            | kwargs                | Description                              |
1595            +=======================+==========================================+
1596            | shortName="VTMP"      | Set shortName to "VTMP", along with      |
1597            |                       | appropriate discipline,                  |
1598            |                       | parameterCategory, parameterNumber,      |
1599            |                       | fullName and units.                      |
1600            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1601            | discipline=0,         | Set shortName, discipline,               |
1602            | parameterCategory=0,  | parameterCategory, parameterNumber,      |
1603            | parameterNumber=1     | fullName and units appropriate for       |
1604            |                       | "Virtual Temperature".                   |
1605            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1606            | discipline=0,         | Conflicting keywords but                 |
1607            | parameterCategory=0,  | 'shortName="TMP"' wins.  Set shortName,  |
1608            | parameterNumber=1,    | discipline, parameterCategory,           |
1609            | shortName="TMP"       | parameterNumber, fullName and units      |
1610            |                       | appropriate for "Temperature".           |
1611            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1612
1613        Returns
1614        -------
1615        DataArray
1616            DataArray with updated attributes.
1617        """
1618        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1619
1620        newmsg = Grib2Message(
1621            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1622            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1623            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1624            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1625            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1626            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1627        )
1628
1629        coords_keys = [
1630            k
1631            for k in da.coords.keys()
1632            if k in AVAILABLE_NON_GEO_COORDS
1633        ]
1634
1635        for grib2_name, value in kwargs.items():
1636            if grib2_name == "gridDefinitionTemplateNumber":
1637                raise ValueError(
1638                    "The gridDefinitionTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated.  The best way to change to a different grid is to interpolate the data to a new grid using the grib2io interpolate functions."
1639                )
1640            if grib2_name == "productDefinitionTemplateNumber":
1641                raise ValueError(
1642                    "The productDefinitionTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated."
1643                )
1644            if grib2_name == "dataRepresentationTemplateNumber":
1645                raise ValueError(
1646                    "The dataRepresentationTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated."
1647                )
1648            if grib2_name in coords_keys:
1649                warnings.warn(
1650                    f"Skipping attribute '{grib2_name}' because it is a coordinate. Use da.assign_coords() to change coordinate values."
1651                )
1652                continue
1653            if hasattr(newmsg, grib2_name):
1654                setattr(newmsg, grib2_name, value)
1655            else:
1656                warnings.warn(
1657                    f"Skipping attribute '{grib2_name}' because it is not a valid GRIB2 attribute for this message and cannot be updated."
1658                )
1659                continue
1660
1661        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"] = newmsg.section0
1662        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"] = newmsg.section1
1663        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"] = newmsg.section2 or []
1664        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"] = newmsg.section3
1665        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"] = newmsg.section4
1666        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"] = newmsg.section5
1667        da.attrs["fullName"] = newmsg.fullName
1668        da.attrs["shortName"] = newmsg.shortName
1669        da.attrs["units"] = newmsg.units
1670
1671        return da
1672
1673    def subset(self, lats, lons) -> xr.DataArray:
1674        """
1675        Subset the DataArray to a region defined by latitudes and longitudes.
1676
1677        Parameters
1678        ----------
1679        lats
1680            Latitude bounds of the region.
1681        lons
1682            Longitude bounds of the region.
1683
1684        Returns
1685        -------
1686        subset
1687            DataArray subset to the region.
1688        """
1689        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1690
1691        newmsg = Grib2Message(
1692            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1693            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1694            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1695            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1696            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1697            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1698        )
1699        newmsg.data = np.copy(da.values)
1700
1701        newmsg = newmsg.subset(lats, lons)
1702
1703        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"] = newmsg.section3
1704
1705        mask_lat = (da.latitude >= newmsg.latitudeLastGridpoint) & (
1706            da.latitude <= newmsg.latitudeFirstGridpoint
1707        )
1708        mask_lon = (da.longitude >= newmsg.longitudeFirstGridpoint) & (
1709            da.longitude <= newmsg.longitudeLastGridpoint
1710        )
1711
1712        return da.where((mask_lon & mask_lat).compute(), drop=True)
Grib2ioDataArray(xarray_obj) 
1319    def __init__(self, xarray_obj):
1320        self._obj = xarray_obj
def griddef(self): 
1322    def griddef(self):
1323        return Grib2GridDef.from_section3(self._obj.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'])
def interp( self, method, grid_def_out, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray: 
1325    def interp(self, method, grid_def_out, method_options=None, num_threads=1) -> xr.DataArray:
1326        """
1327        Perform grid spatial interpolation.
1328
1329        Uses the [NCEPLIBS-ip library](https://github.com/NOAA-EMC/NCEPLIBS-ip).
1330
1331        Parameters
1332        ----------
1333        method
1334            Interpolate method to use. This can either be an integer or string
1335            using the following mapping:
1336
1337            | Interpolate Scheme | Integer Value |
1338            | :---:              | :---:         |
1339            | 'bilinear'         | 0             |
1340            | 'bicubic'          | 1             |
1341            | 'neighbor'         | 2             |
1342            | 'budget'           | 3             |
1343            | 'spectral'         | 4             |
1344            | 'neighbor-budget'  | 6             |
1345        grid_def_out
1346            Grib2GridDef object of the output grid.
1347        method_options : list of ints, optional
1348            Interpolation options. See the NCEPLIBS-ip documentation for
1349            more information on how these are used.
1350        num_threads : int, optional
1351            Number of OpenMP threads to use for interpolation. The default
1352            value is 1. If grib2io_interp was not built with OpenMP, then
1353            this keyword argument and value will have no impact.
1354
1355        Returns
1356        -------
1357        interp
1358            DataSet interpolated to new grid definition.  The attribute
1359            GRIB2IO_section3 is replaced with the section3 array from the new
1360            grid definition.
1361        """
1362        da = self._obj
1363        # ensure that y, x are rightmost dims; they should be if opening with
1364        # grib2io engine
1365
1366        # gdtn and gdt is not the entirety of the new s3
1367        npoints = grid_def_out.npoints
1368        s3_new = np.array([0, npoints, 0, 0, grid_def_out.gdtn] + list(grid_def_out.gdt))
1369
1370        # make new lat lons
1371        lats, lons = Grib2Message(section3=s3_new, pdtn=0, drtn=0).grid()
1372        latitude = xr.DataArray(lats, dims=['y', 'x'])
1373        longitude = xr.DataArray(lons, dims=['y', 'x'])
1374
1375        # create new coords
1376        new_coords = dict(da.coords)
1377        del new_coords['latitude']
1378        del new_coords['longitude']
1379        new_coords['longitude'] = longitude
1380        new_coords['latitude'] = latitude
1381
1382        # make grid def in from section3 on da.attrs
1383        grid_def_in = self.griddef()
1384
1385        if da.chunks is None:
1386            data = interp_nd(da.data, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1387                             grid_def_out=grid_def_out,
1388                             method_options=method_options, num_threads=num_threads)
1389        else:
1390            import dask
1391            front_shape = da.shape[:-2]
1392            data = da.data.map_blocks(interp_nd, method=method, grid_def_in=grid_def_in,
1393                                      grid_def_out=grid_def_out, method_options=method_options,
1394                                      chunks=da.chunks[:-2]+latitude.shape, dtype=da.dtype)
1395
1396        new_da = xr.DataArray(data, dims=da.dims, coords=new_coords, attrs=da.attrs)
1397
1398        new_da.attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'] = s3_new
1399        new_da.name = da.name
1400        return new_da

1559
1560            # For dimension coordinates, set the grib2 message metadata to the
1561            # dimension coordinate value.
1562            for index, value in filters.items():
1563                if index not in loc_indexes:
1564                    setattr(newmsg, index, value)
1565
1566            # For non-dimension coordinates, set the grib2 message metadata to
1567            # the DataArray coordinate value.
1568            for index in [i for i in coords_keys if i not in da.dims]:
1569                setattr(newmsg, index, selected.coords[index].values)
1570
1571            # Set section 5 attributes to the da.encoding dictionary.
1572            for key, value in selected.encoding.items():
1573                if key in ["dtype", "chunks", "original_shape"]:
1574                    continue
1575                setattr(newmsg, key, value)
1576
1577            # write the message to file
1578            with grib2io.open(filename, mode=mode) as f:
1579                f.write(newmsg)
1580            mode = "a"

Write a DataArray to a grib2 file.

Parameters
  • filename: Name of the grib2 file to write to.

  • mode ({"x", "w", "a"}, optional, default="x"): Persistence mode

    +------+-----------------------------------+ | mode | Description | +======+===================================+ | x | create (fail if exists) | +------+-----------------------------------+ | w | create (overwrite if exists) | +------+-----------------------------------+ | a | append (create if does not exist) | +------+-----------------------------------+

def update_attrs(self, **kwargs): 
1582    def update_attrs(self, **kwargs):
1583        """
1584        Update many of the attributes of the DataArray.
1585
1586        Parameters
1587        ----------
1588        **kwargs
1589            Attributes to update.  This can include many of the GRIB2IO message
1590            attributes that you can find when you print a GRIB2IO message. For
1591            conflicting updates, the last keyword will be used.
1592
1593            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1594            | kwargs                | Description                              |
1595            +=======================+==========================================+
1596            | shortName="VTMP"      | Set shortName to "VTMP", along with      |
1597            |                       | appropriate discipline,                  |
1598            |                       | parameterCategory, parameterNumber,      |
1599            |                       | fullName and units.                      |
1600            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1601            | discipline=0,         | Set shortName, discipline,               |
1602            | parameterCategory=0,  | parameterCategory, parameterNumber,      |
1603            | parameterNumber=1     | fullName and units appropriate for       |
1604            |                       | "Virtual Temperature".                   |
1605            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1606            | discipline=0,         | Conflicting keywords but                 |
1607            | parameterCategory=0,  | 'shortName="TMP"' wins.  Set shortName,  |
1608            | parameterNumber=1,    | discipline, parameterCategory,           |
1609            | shortName="TMP"       | parameterNumber, fullName and units      |
1610            |                       | appropriate for "Temperature".           |
1611            +-----------------------+------------------------------------------+
1612
1613        Returns
1614        -------
1615        DataArray
1616            DataArray with updated attributes.
1617        """
1618        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1619
1620        newmsg = Grib2Message(
1621            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1622            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1623            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1624            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1625            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1626            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1627        )
1628
1629        coords_keys = [
1630            k
1631            for k in da.coords.keys()
1632            if k in AVAILABLE_NON_GEO_COORDS
1633        ]
1634
1635        for grib2_name, value in kwargs.items():
1636            if grib2_name == "gridDefinitionTemplateNumber":
1637                raise ValueError(
1638                    "The gridDefinitionTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated.  The best way to change to a different grid is to interpolate the data to a new grid using the grib2io interpolate functions."
1639                )
1640            if grib2_name == "productDefinitionTemplateNumber":
1641                raise ValueError(
1642                    "The productDefinitionTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated."
1643                )
1644            if grib2_name == "dataRepresentationTemplateNumber":
1645                raise ValueError(
1646                    "The dataRepresentationTemplateNumber attribute cannot be updated."
1647                )
1648            if grib2_name in coords_keys:
1649                warnings.warn(
1650                    f"Skipping attribute '{grib2_name}' because it is a coordinate. Use da.assign_coords() to change coordinate values."
1651                )
1652                continue
1653            if hasattr(newmsg, grib2_name):
1654                setattr(newmsg, grib2_name, value)
1655            else:
1656                warnings.warn(
1657                    f"Skipping attribute '{grib2_name}' because it is not a valid GRIB2 attribute for this message and cannot be updated."
1658                )
1659                continue
1660
1661        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"] = newmsg.section0
1662        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"] = newmsg.section1
1663        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"] = newmsg.section2 or []
1664        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"] = newmsg.section3
1665        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"] = newmsg.section4
1666        da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"] = newmsg.section5
1667        da.attrs["fullName"] = newmsg.fullName
1668        da.attrs["shortName"] = newmsg.shortName
1669        da.attrs["units"] = newmsg.units
1670
1671        return da

def subset(self, lats, lons) -> xarray.core.dataarray.DataArray: 
1673    def subset(self, lats, lons) -> xr.DataArray:
1674        """
1675        Subset the DataArray to a region defined by latitudes and longitudes.
1676
1677        Parameters
1678        ----------
1679        lats
1680            Latitude bounds of the region.
1681        lons
1682            Longitude bounds of the region.
1683
1684        Returns
1685        -------
1686        subset
1687            DataArray subset to the region.
1688        """
1689        da = self._obj.copy(deep=True)
1690
1691        newmsg = Grib2Message(
1692            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section0"],
1693            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section1"],
1694            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section2"],
1695            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section3"],
1696            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section4"],
1697            da.attrs["GRIB2IO_section5"],
1698        )
1699        newmsg.data = np.copy(da.values)
1700

1702

1704
1705        mask_lat = (da.latitude >= newmsg.latitudeLastGridpoint) & (
1706            da.latitude <= newmsg.latitudeFirstGridpoint
1707        )
1708        mask_lon = (da.longitude >= newmsg.longitudeFirstGridpoint) & (
1709            da.longitude <= newmsg.longitudeLastGridpoint
1710        )
1711
1712        return da.where((mask_lon & mask_lat).compute(), drop=True)

def build_datatree_from_grib(filename, file_index, filters=None, stack_vertical=False): 
1715def build_datatree_from_grib(filename, file_index, filters=None, stack_vertical=False):
1716    """
1717    Build a DataTree from GRIB2 messages.
1718
1719    Parameters
1720    ----------
1721    filename : str
1722        Path to the GRIB2 file.
1723    file_index : pandas.DataFrame
1724        DataFrame of GRIB2 message index.
1725    filters : dict, optional
1726        Filter criteria for GRIB2 messages.
1727    stack_vertical : bool, optional
1728        If True, vertical levels will be stacked in a single dataset
1729        instead of being organized in separate tree nodes.
1730
1731    Returns
1732    -------
1733    xarray.DataTree
1734        A hierarchical DataTree representation of the GRIB2 data.
1735    """
1736    if filters is None:
1737        filters = {}
1738
1739    # Apply any filters from user
1740    for k, v in filters.items():
1741        if k not in file_index.columns:
1742            file_index = file_index.copy()
1743            file_index[k] = file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, k, None))
1744        file_index = filter_index(file_index, k, v)
1745
1746    # Make a copy to avoid the SettingWithCopyWarning
1747    file_index = file_index.copy()
1748
1749    # Extract metadata needed for tree organization
1750    # Use a safer approach to handle missing attributes
1751    def safe_getattr(obj, name):
1752        try:
1753            attr = getattr(obj, name)
1754            # Need to test if the attribute is Grib2Metadata. If so,
1755            # then get the value attribute.
1756            if isinstance(attr, grib2io.templates.Grib2Metadata):
1757                attr = attr.value
1758            return attr
1759        except (AttributeError, KeyError):
1760            return None
1761
1762    for attr in TREE_HIERARCHY_LEVELS:
1763        if (attr not in file_index.columns) and (attr != 'valueOfFirstFixedSurface'):
1764            file_index[attr] = file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: safe_getattr(msg, attr))
1765
1766    # Also extract shortName for variable naming
1767    if 'shortName' not in file_index.columns:
1768        file_index = file_index.assign(shortName=file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, 'shortName', None)))
1769        file_index = file_index.assign(nx=file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, 'nx', None)))
1770        file_index = file_index.assign(ny=file_index.msg.apply(lambda msg: getattr(msg, 'ny', None)))
1771
1772    # Create root DataTree
1773    root = xr.DataTree()
1774
1775    # Adjust hierarchy levels if we're stacking vertical levels
1776    hierarchy_levels = list(TREE_HIERARCHY_LEVELS)
1777    if stack_vertical and "valueOfFirstFixedSurface" in hierarchy_levels:
1778        hierarchy_levels.remove("valueOfFirstFixedSurface")
1779
1780    # First group by level type
1781    level_groups = {}
1782
1783    # Create a dictionary to group data by level type
1784    for level_type in file_index['typeOfFirstFixedSurface'].unique():
1785        if pd.notna(level_type):  # Skip None/NaN values
1786            level_info = LEVEL_NAME_MAPPING.get(level_type, f"level_{level_type}")
1787            level_name = level_info[0]
1788            level_source = level_info[1]
1789            # Get all rows for this level type
1790            level_data = file_index[file_index['typeOfFirstFixedSurface'] == level_type]
1791            level_groups[level_type] = {'name': level_name, 'data': level_data}
1792
1793    # Process each level group
1794    for level_type, group_info in level_groups.items():
1795        level_name = group_info['name']
1796        level_df = group_info['data']
1797
1798        # Create a branch for this level type
1799        level_tree = xr.DataTree()
1800
1801        # Process this branch based on PDTN, perturbation number, etc.
1802        process_level_branch(level_tree, level_df, filename)
1803
1804        # Add this branch to the main tree
1805        root[level_name] = level_tree
1806
1807    return root

Build a DataTree from GRIB2 messages.

Parameters
  • filename (str): Path to the GRIB2 file.
  • file_index (pandas.DataFrame): DataFrame of GRIB2 message index.
  • filters (dict, optional): Filter criteria for GRIB2 messages.
  • stack_vertical (bool, optional): If True, vertical levels will be stacked in a single dataset instead of being organized in separate tree nodes.
Returns
  • xarray.DataTree: A hierarchical DataTree representation of the GRIB2 data.
def process_level_branch(level_tree, df, filename): 
1810def process_level_branch(level_tree, df, filename):
1811    """
1812    Process a level type branch of the data tree, organizing by PDTN and other attributes.
1813
1814    Parameters
1815    ----------
1816    level_tree : xarray.DataTree
1817        The DataTree node for this level type
1818    df : pandas.DataFrame
1819        DataFrame of messages for this level type
1820    filename : str
1821        Path to the GRIB2 file
1822    """
1823    # Group by PDTN
1824    pdtn_groups = {}
1825
1826    # Group data by PDTN first
1827    for pdtn_value in df['productDefinitionTemplateNumber'].unique():
1828        if pd.notna(pdtn_value):
1829            pdtn_df = df[df['productDefinitionTemplateNumber'] == pdtn_value]
1830            pdtn_groups[pdtn_value] = pdtn_df
1831
1832    # If there's only one PDTN value, skip creating PDTN branch level
1833    if len(pdtn_groups) == 1:
1834        pdtn, pdtn_df = next(iter(pdtn_groups.items()))
1835
1836        pdtn_name = f"pdtn_{int(pdtn)}"
1837
1838        # Check if we need to further subdivide by perturbation number
1839        has_perturbations = ('perturbationNumber' in pdtn_df.columns and
1840                             len(pdtn_df['perturbationNumber'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1841
1842        # Check if we need to further subdivide by probabilities unique for each variable.
1843        has_probabilities = ('typeOfProbability' in pdtn_df.columns and
1844                             len(pdtn_df['typeOfProbability'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1845
1846        if has_perturbations:
1847            # Process perturbations directly on the level tree
1848            process_perturbation_groups(level_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1849        elif has_probabilities:
1850            # Process probability groups
1851            process_probability_groups(level_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1852        else:
1853            # Try to create dataset directly on level
1854            try:
1855                dss = create_datasets_from_df(pdtn_df, filename)
1856                if dss is not None:
1857                    dt = xr.DataTree()
1858                    if len(dss) == 1:
1859                        dt.ds = dss[0]
1860                    else:
1861                        for ds in dss:
1862                            varname = list(ds.data_vars)[0]
1863                            dt[f"var_{varname}"] = ds
1864                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = dt
1865            except Exception as e:
1866                print(f"Error creating dataset for level with pdtn {int(pdtn)}: {e}")
1867
1868                # Try to separate by variable name as a fallback
1869                try_process_by_variables(level_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1870    else:
1871        # Multiple PDTN values, process each group with PDTN branch nodes
1872        for pdtn, pdtn_df in pdtn_groups.items():
1873            # Use a simple node name that's easy to use in code
1874            pdtn_name = f"pdtn_{int(pdtn)}"
1875
1876            # Check if we need to further subdivide by perturbation number
1877            has_perturbations = ('perturbationNumber' in pdtn_df.columns and
1878                                 len(pdtn_df['perturbationNumber'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1879
1880            # Check if we need to further subdivide by probabilities unique for each variable.
1881            has_probabilities = ('typeOfProbability' in pdtn_df.columns and
1882                                 len(pdtn_df['typeOfProbability'].dropna().unique()) > 1)
1883
1884            if has_perturbations:
1885                # Create a branch for this PDTN
1886                pdtn_tree = xr.DataTree()
1887
1888                # Process perturbation groups
1889                process_perturbation_groups(pdtn_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1890
1891                # Only add the PDTN branch if it has children
1892                if len(pdtn_tree.children) > 0 or pdtn_tree.ds is not None:
1893                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree
1894            elif has_probabilities:
1895                # Create a branch for this PDTN
1896                pdtn_tree = xr.DataTree()
1897
1898                # Process probability groups
1899                process_probability_groups(pdtn_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1900
1901                # Only add the PDTN branch if it has children
1902                if len(pdtn_tree.children) > 0 or pdtn_tree.ds is not None:
1903                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree
1904            else:
1905                # Create a subtree for this PDTN
1906                pdtn_tree = xr.DataTree()
1907
1908                # Try to create dataset directly on level
1909                try:
1910                    dss = create_datasets_from_df(pdtn_df, filename)
1911                    if dss is not None:
1912                        if len(dss) == 1:
1913                            pdtn_tree.ds = dss[0]
1914                        else:
1915                            for ds in dss:
1916                                varname = list(ds.data_vars)[0]
1917                                pdtn_tree[f"var_{varname}"] = ds
1918                        level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree
1919                except Exception as e:
1920                    print(f"Error creating dataset for level with pdtn {int(pdtn)}: {e}")
1921
1922                    # Try to separate by variable name as a fallback
1923                    try_process_by_variables(pdtn_tree, pdtn_df, filename)
1924                    level_tree[pdtn_name] = pdtn_tree

Process a level type branch of the data tree, organizing by PDTN and other attributes.

def process_probability_groups(target_tree, pdtn_df, filename): 
1927def process_probability_groups(target_tree, pdtn_df, filename):
1928    """
1929    """
1930    success = False
1931    # Group by type of probability
1932    prob_groups = {}
1933    for prob_value in pdtn_df['typeOfProbability'].unique():

Try to separate data by variable names and create datasets.

def create_datasets_from_df( df, filename, verbose=False) -> Optional[List[xarray.core.dataset.Dataset]]: 
2061def create_datasets_from_df(
2062    df,
2063    filename,
2064    verbose=False
2065) -> typing.Optional[typing.List[xr.Dataset]]:
2066    """
2067    Create a list of xarray Datasets from a DataFrame of messages.
2068
2069    Parameters
2070    ----------
2071    df : pandas.DataFrame
2072        DataFrame of GRIB messages
2073    filename : str
2074        Path to the GRIB2 file
2075    verbose : bool, optional
2076        If True, prints detailed debugging information
2077
2078    Returns
2079    -------
2080    dss
2081        List of Datasets, or None if creation failed
2082    """
2083    try:
2084        if verbose:
2085            print(f"\n==== VERBOSE DEBUG INFO ====")
2086            print(f"Creating dataset from DataFrame with {len(df)} messages")
2087            print(f"DataFrame columns: {df.columns.tolist()}")
2088
2089            if 'shortName' in df.columns:
2090                print(f"Variables in group: {df['shortName'].unique().tolist()}")
2091
2092            if 'valueOfFirstFixedSurface' in df.columns:
2093                print(f"Vertical levels: {df['valueOfFirstFixedSurface'].unique().tolist()}")
2094
2095        # Process by variables
2096        datasets = {}
2097
2098        # Process each variable separately, regardless of whether there are vertical levels
2099        for var_name, var_df in df.groupby('shortName'):
2100            if verbose:

2114                    try:
2115                        # Parse the index and get dimensions for this level
2116                        file_index, non_geo_dims, attrs, coord_attrs = parse_grib_index(level_df, {})

2118                        non_geo_dims = [d for d in non_geo_dims if d.__name__ != "ValueOfFirstFixedSurfaceDim"]

2124                            level_da = build_da_without_coords(frames[0], cube, filename, attrs)

@xr.register_datatree_accessor('grib2io')
class Grib2ioDataTree: 
2253    @xr.register_datatree_accessor("grib2io")
2254    class Grib2ioDataTree:
2255        """
2256        DataTree accessor for GRIB2 files.
2257
2258        This accessor provides methods for working with GRIB2 data organized
2259        in a hierarchical tree structure.
2260        """
2261
2262        def __init__(self, datatree_obj):
2263            self._obj = datatree_obj
2264
2265        def to_grib2(self, filename, mode: typing.Literal["x", "w", "a"] = "x"):
2266            """
2267            Write all datasets in the DataTree to a GRIB2 file.
2268
2269            Parameters
2270            ----------
2271            filename : str
2272                Name of the GRIB2 file to write to.
2273            mode : {"x", "w", "a"}, optional
2274                Persistence mode, default is "x" (create, fail if exists)
2275            """
2276            # Start with the specified mode
2277            current_mode = mode
2278
2279            # Function to recursively process the tree
2280            def process_tree(node):
2281                nonlocal current_mode
2282
2283                # If this is a Dataset node with data variables
2284                if node.ds is not None and node.ds.data_vars:
2285                    # Write dataset to GRIB2 file
2286                    node.ds.grib2io.to_grib2(filename, mode=current_mode)
2287                    # Switch to append mode after first write
2288                    current_mode = "a"
2289
2290                # Process children
2291                for child_name, child_node in node.children.items():
2292                    process_tree(child_node)
2293
2294            # Start processing from the root
2295            process_tree(self._obj)
2296
2297        def griddef(self):
2298            """
2299            Get the grid definition from the first dataset in the tree that has one.
2300
2301            Returns
2302            -------
2303            grib2io.Grib2GridDef
2304                Grid definition object
2305            """
2306            # Function to find first dataset with GRIB2IO_section3
2307            def find_griddef(node):
2308                if node.ds is not None and node.ds.data_vars:
2309                    for var_name in node.ds.data_vars:
2310                        if 'GRIB2IO_section3' in node.ds[var_name].attrs:
2311                            return Grib2GridDef.from_section3(node.ds[var_name].attrs['GRIB2IO_section3'])
2312
2313                # Check children
2314                for child_name, child_node in node.children.items():
2315                    griddef = find_griddef(child_node)
2316                    if griddef is not None:
2317                        return griddef
2318
2319                return None
2320
2321            return find_griddef(self._obj)
2322
2323        def interp(self, method, grid_def_out, method_options=None, num_threads=1):
2324            """
2325            Interpolate all datasets in the tree to a new grid.
2326
2327            Parameters
2328            ----------
2329            method : str or int
2330                Interpolation method to use
2331            grid_def_out : grib2io.Grib2GridDef
2332                Target grid definition
2333            method_options : list, optional
2334                Options for interpolation method
2335            num_threads : int, optional
2336                Number of threads to use for interpolation
2337
2338            Returns
2339            -------
2340            xarray.DataTree
2341                New DataTree with interpolated data
2342            """
2343            new_tree = xr.DataTree()
2344
2345            # Function to recursively process the tree
2346            def process_tree(node, new_parent):
2347                # If this is a Dataset node with data variables
2348                if node.ds is not None and node.ds.data_vars:
2349                    # Interpolate dataset
2350                    interp_ds = node.ds.grib2io.interp(method, grid_def_out,
2351                                                       method_options=method_options,
2352                                                       num_threads=num_threads)
2353
2354                    # Add to new tree at the same path
2355                    if node == self._obj:  # Root node
2356                        new_parent.ds = interp_ds
2357                    else:
2358                        new_parent.ds = interp_ds
2359
2360                # Process children
2361                for child_name, child_node in node.children.items():
2362                    # Create same child in new tree
2363                    new_child = xr.DataTree()
2364                    new_parent[child_name] = new_child
2365                    process_tree(child_node, new_child)
2366
2367            # Start processing from the root
2368            process_tree(self._obj, new_tree)
2369
2370            return new_tree
2371
2372        def subset(self, lats, lons):

2374            Subset all datasets in the tree to a region.

2381                Longitude bounds [min_lon, max_lon]

2386                New DataTree with subset data
2387            """
2388            new_tree = xr.DataTree()
2389
2390            # Function to recursively process the tree
2391            def process_tree(node, new_parent):
2392                # If this is a Dataset node with data variables
2393                if node.ds is not None and node.ds.data_vars:
2394                    # Subset dataset
2395                    subset_ds = node.ds.grib2io.subset(lats, lons)
2396
2397                    # Add to new tree at the same path
2398                    if node == self._obj:  # Root node
2399                        new_parent.ds = subset_ds
2400                    else:
2401                        new_parent.ds = subset_ds
2402
2403                # Process children
2404                for child_name, child_node in node.children.items():
2405                    # Create same child in new tree
2406                    new_child = xr.DataTree()
2407                    new_parent[child_name] = new_child
